boardgame.name: Tapestry of Lies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 3rd-4th Level Characters set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

For many years, the village of Carrickmoor has been plagued every spring by an influx of giant vermin. So far, no one has been able to determine their source. The locals are frustrated enough with the situation that they are offering a reward of up to 100 gp to anyone who can do something about this seasonal threat.

boardgame.name: One Dark Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 3 to 5 players with an average party level of 5th Level set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

Wilhelm’s Eve, named for a popular vindari poet, Jacob Wilhelm, is held on the winter solstice each year. During most of the day, the faithful of the One True God gather in boisterous crowds, singing and making merry in order to ward off evil. Near sunset though, criminals and heretics are executed before those same crowds, as popularized in Wilhelm’s poetry. After the executions, the vindari return home, lock their doors and bar their windows. Evil spirits are believed to wander openly on Wilhelm’s Eve Night, and it is considered grave misfortune to be outside while the moon shines.

Each year, people are killed on Wilhelm’s Eve, seemingly at random, in different vindari cities around Vathak. They are found the next morning butchered in the street, by someone or something colloquially known as “the Wilhelm Killers.” Although some have been “brought to justice” for these killings, they never stop, and this year is no different. A Wilhelm Killer has come to Kandar, and the PCs find themselves outside after sunset.

boardgame.name: What Price Salvation?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 4 char4acters of 3rd to 4th level set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

About a month ago, odd happenings began to occur in the village of Heidersdorf. A three–beaked chicken was seen clucking down the street, swirling clouds of iridescent smoke wrapped around the bakery for an hour, no one so much as stubbed a toe on one day, and other such peculiar things. The villagers have turned to the Bürgermeister and his advisors (all older men of good reputation) for guidance, but they can do little aside from urge people to pray for protection. Many have turned to the solace of a drink and good cheer at the local tavern, The Three Sisters, at night, careful to leave for their homes in groups of two or more.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Spawn of Yeghniths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 3 to 5 characters with an average party level of 7th set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

The town of Kandar has recently been shaken by a slew of shared nightmares that have afflicted the people. About the same time as the nightmares started, an earthquake shook the region, and explorers
reported a new cave having opened up… A cave matching the one seen in the very nightmares people are experiencing. A few brave individuals have already tried to enter the cave, but none have returned. Hoping to stem the suffering of his people, Burgher Vantino has once again hired from outside of Kandar to solve the problem.

boardgame.name: You Left Me to the Wolves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 4 1st level characters set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

Despite the increasing cold covering the lands and the days getting shorter and darker, hunters and trappers hurry to gather as many furs as possible before the weather becomes unbearable. Traditionally, the Resvrrectvris Festival marks the end of the season, and many romni that keep camps during the warmer seasons in the Muskeg Bog and the Kraklevak Forest make the dangerous journey to Kandar to sell their wares and enjoy family and friends over the coldest weeks of the winter.

Recently, though, travelers have reported an increase in wolf attacks. One last meal before the frigid starving months ahead.

boardgame.name: When the Forest Speaks... Part One
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 4 players with an average party level of 2nd to 3rd level set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

Lars Karstenburg, an ambitious vindari eager to make a name for himself among Grigoria’s mercantile elite, has established himself in the growing lumber industry of the remote city of Kandar. He sees the ancient romni community — and its inhabitants — as a stepping stone to greater things, and acts accordingly. He eyes the primeval stands of birch and spruce in the nearby Kraklevak Forest as a resource to be exploited, and he drives his work crews mercilessly to harvest as much of the coveted, and profitable, timber as possible. But what happens when a would-be lumber baron’s reach exceeds their grasp?

boardgame.name: When the Forest Speaks... Part Two
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for four players with an average party level of 2nd to 3rd level set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

The adventurers have been hired by Lars Karstenburg, an up–and–coming vindari merchant trying to make a name for himself in Kandar’s lumber trade, to investigate why shipments of raw timber from his logging camp in the Kraklevak Forest have stopped. After doing some investigating in town, the party learns that all does not appear to be well at the camp: Lars has been driving his workers to cut down as many Kraklevak Birches — which are considered luxury wood in the south, and are highly sought after — as possible. The characters learn of a heated argument about something happening at the camp, the dismissal of Lars’ foreman, Aldo Brazauskas, and then silence.

boardgame.name: The Witchwolf
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The witchwolves stem from a unique mixture of bloodlines that have come together in an unnatural union. All witchwolves come from romni lineage and carry trace amounts of the hag blood found amongst their people. This, combined with the most terrible and brutal blood of a werewolf forebearer has created a union quickly establishing itself as a new race in Vathak.

Instead... they got something else.

boardgame.name: Hauntlings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hauntlings are creatures born with a close connection to the undead, particularly those of a ghostly nature. The true origin of the race is unknown, but many scholars have theories on what causes these strange abnormalities.

boardgame.name: キャトルミューティレーション (CATTLE MUTILATION)
boardgame.description:
キャトルミューティレーション (CATTLE MUTILATION) is a co-operative memo-style game from Japan. The players are cattle farmers, trying to improve their stock, but aliens abduct and harm the cattle. The farmers must try to reconcile matters with the aliens in order to save their herd.

The game has tiles showing various flying saucers, and alien tiles showing a saucer with its levitation beam on one side, and human to alien handshake on the other, numbered 1 to 10.

A tableau of face-down tiles for the various flying saucers is surrounded by the tiles showing beams. As players turn up saucers, they can pay cow tokens to the abduction beams to move them about. If the players can turn up a matching pair of saucers, they can flip a beam saucer to its handshake side, and recover the cow tokens.

In this way, players try to build up peace with the aliens, by retrieving handshakes without sacrificing too many cows.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameartist: Soya Okamura (オカムラ ソーヤ)

boardgame.name: Deviant: The Renegades
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Remade - You woke up…different. Someone changed you; on a slab, an operating table, an altar. By luck or by fate, you escaped. Now you’re hunted by the ones who made you, and they hold all the cards but one: they don’t know that a fire burns within you because of what they did. They don’t know that you’re hunting them.

Broken - The Divergence stripped you of your humanity, cracked open your soul. Its wounds will never heal. You are Broken — not like a toy lying in a limp pile on the floor but like a glass bottle, all sharp edges and jagged, cutting shards. Anyone who comes close to you bleeds — your enemies, but also your few friends.

Renegades - Though alienated from humanity, you are not alone. Other Deviants have suffered as you have suffered. They hate the conspiracies that made you as much as you do. Together, you will stand against them. Together, you will make them pay!

This book contains:

The complete guide to playing a Deviant in the Chronicles of Darkness — from psychics to cyborgs, from freaks of nature to abominations of science.


Customizable powers and drawbacks to accommodate a breathtakingly diverse range of character concepts.
Rules for portraying the many faceless conspiracies that make up the Web of Pain.
Four example settings across the world, from Ankara to Delaware, each with its own unique conspiracies entangled in the Web of Pain.

boardgame.name: アルス・ノタリア (Ars Notalia)
boardgame.description:
アルス・ノタリア　～君は魔法陣クリエイター～ (Ars Notalia -You are a magic circle creator-) is a drawing game from Japan. Players are students of magic, having taken up a 4 week internship at a magical research company. Their goal is to improve their grades and hopefully gain full-time magic work.

Each week they complete a magical research on a particular. A spell is formed from a combination of two word cards (English included). Players use agreed symbols to represent the components of the spell (water, fire and so on). Each player draws a version of the spell from the symbols required.

At the end of the course, each player studies the spells drawn by the other students, and casts a secret vote on how well they have been drawn. Players are looking for how easily the drawing is to read, and how well it matches the requirements of the spell.

Once all the votes are cast, the scores are revealed and totalled up. The best score wins the game and a new job.

Players must try to draw out on paper a spell, decoratively and cleverly. But it must be recognisable as the spell, and not too difficult to read and interpret correctly. A spell that is too easy, or too obscure, should score lower marks than a more finely crafted work.

The game has been presented as a Print'n'Play, with the black & white files online under a password, being released for the low price of ¥ 500.
user summary

boardgame.name: Fleet: The Dice Game (Second Edition) – Score Pads
boardgame.description:
Each scorepad contains 50 double-sided sheets for 100 additional plays.

What's different from the 1st edition?
Updated scorepad (Lobster Licenses changed a little to be less confusing, graphic updates, changes to Income reminder on the bottom left).

boardgame.name: Darwin's Journey: Collector's Edition
boardgame.description:
Darwin’s Journey: Collector’s Edition contains both the base game and the Fireland Expansion. This is a Kickstarter EXCLUSIVE edition and will not be available at retail. It includes the following additional content and deluxe components:

- 40 metal coins in two denominations (1s and 5s) with “aged” wash finish
- Illustrated drawstring bag for the metal coins
- 68 soft plastic wax seals in 5 different colours, each with a unique design
- Deluxe, round-bottomed, stand-up cotton bag for the wax seals
- Dual-layered player boards
- 2 Crew Cards
- 4 Scenario Cards
- 10 Player Objective tiles
- 3 Beagle Goal tiles
- 6 Companion Cards
- 4 Evolution wooden tokens with silver metallic ink finish
- 4 Insect wooden tokens with silver metallic ink finish
- 4 Pocket Watch wooden tokens with silver metallic ink finish
- 2 Time tiles
- 5 Special Action tiles
- 1 double-sided Correspondence tile
- Great Ship Mini Expansion (11 Great Ship Cards)
- Pirates Mini Expansion (4 Crew Cards, 1 wooden screen-printed Pirate Ship token, 1 Special Action tile and 9 Treasure Chest tokens with heat transfer foil finish)
- 1 custom moulded plastic insert
- HMS Beagle screen-printed wooden ship memorabilia

The Fireland Expansion includes a new map and alternative board layout with new mechanisms and additional content. It contains:

- 4 Ships
- 4 Explorers
- 4 coloured discs
- 3 Bookmark tokens
- 4 Special Action tiles
- 2 Player Objective tiles
- 2 Crew Cards
- 21 Adventure Cards (land and ocean)
- 20 wooden Adventure tokens with heat transfer foil finish
- 4 Adventure Player Aid cards
- 6 Observation score tokens
- 6 Time tiles
- 8 soft plastic wax Time seals

boardgame.name: Charley Horse Derby
boardgame.description:
Charley Horse Derby is a strategic horse-racing game.

Players choose their jockey card and are dealt two strategy cards. The players race around the around the track for 1 1/4 mile. You can play strategy cards on your turn. You can also pick up cards off the track by landing on a "charley" which are played right away. Use the tools the track gives you to send other opponents back or propel yourself forward.

Ride the rails on the bends for a shorter race or take the longer outside tracks to grab cards to jeopardize your opponent.

During the race players will encounter bears, deer, goats, snakes, and murder hornets while dealing with collusion, elbowing, impeding and broken legs. Then there's those nasty "trade places" which you have to use before someone crosses the finish line.

You collect cards by rolling doubles or by landing on an opponent and some cards allow you to steal a card from a player. If you can steal an opponent's jockey card, they can't cross the finish line without one. Crossing first doesn't guarantee a win since all players get to finish their turn. Horses unfortunately die on the track so we added one death card. You have be careful using it because if the opponent neighs it, you're dead. Neigh cards are used to block actions of an opponent or have them miss a turn or to save your own hide.

The cards coupled with the track makes for a hilarious game where the horses are all over the place. You won't know who wins until the last player goes.

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
open but never played, excellent condition.
Non smoking house hold
buy more and save on shipping
message me if you would like to buy

boardgame.name: Vive la France !
boardgame.description:
In Vive la France ! each player gets to play a faction and to sets up plots, each more improbable than the next, defend them and then try to impose them.
Fast, simple and fun .

Once the Factions are assigned, the game can begin!
It is broken down into several game turns and phases.
Firstly - players have 4 turns to create conspiracy theories (using memes on the cards).
Then they have to present their conspiracy, remembering as many memes as possible from the previous phase. They score a point for each one.
The players will then use their faction cards to hire some personalities to get special advantages for the next phases.

And so on until one player gets enough points to win.

boardgame.name: Sorcerer City: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: This 80-piece set of custom interlocking metal coins is a deluxe upgrade to Sorcerer City. With a wide range of values, these coins are also perfect to upgrade any tabletop game or rpg that uses currency.

boardgame.name: The 30s - Hunting in the Dust
boardgame.description:
Inside, you'll find:


A Brief History of Shit Being The Worst: A guide to the 1930s, some historical events, and hunter stunts to bring it home.
Hunting in the Dust: Four new types of hunters for the period, and thoughts on how the hunt works in the era.
Heist Generator: A gig generator for motivated entrepreneurs ready to relieve monsters of their cash.
Monsters: Four new monsters, including three classic movie monsters, courtesy the public domain!
It's Not What It Looks Like: The first episode script for a radio drama set in 1930s San Jenaro.

boardgame.name: Chimera System Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The idea for the Chimera Roleplaying System began when I was trying to find a solution to my tabletop RPG needs. I wanted a game that was simple rules-wise, that felt familiar and contained the best aspects of the games I have played, but as issues started to emerge and fixes were applied, the game evolved into a completely different beast.

I won’t try to disguise this game as revolutionary, unique, nor say it is the best. What I will tell you is that it was put together with love and aimed towards those with some experience with tabletop roleplaying games that wish to play a rules-medium game but with enough options to cover most character archetypes.

boardgame.name: El juego de Vitoria-Gasteiz
Vitoria-Gasteiz Ko Jokoa
boardgame.description:
El juego de Vitoria-Gasteiz, a Monopoly-like game that invites you to walk the streets of the capital of Alava, buy and invest in some of its 57 local businesses.

In this game, the winner is the first player who acquires seven venues.

boardgame.name: Practice Board Game
boardgame.description:
The board is a track from Square 1 to Square 63. First to reach the last square wins. Movement is governed by a die roll. Throwing a 6 entitles you to another throw. When you land on the special squares you must follow the instructions. Most of these tell you to play a certain tune on your recorder. If played correctly you get another throw. To win you must throw the exact number to land first on the final square.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Maytaway Quarterly 1.1
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:

Issue 1.1 of Maytaway Quarterly: The all-Indigenous sports and gaming magazine. This issue includes:

Editorial from Taylor Daigneault (Métis)

Looking Back & Giving Back by Shayna Powless (Oneida)

Designing Theurgy by Brendan Prettie (Métis)

Tower of Baybayin by Mylene Speidel (Tagalog)

As well as features on Jack Jacobs (Creek), Brayden Chee (Navajo), and a celebrations of Indigenous excellence from around the world.

boardgame.name: El Castillo del Terror 2
boardgame.description:
Expansion to Castillo del Terror.

Includes:

new monsters with abilities and powers.
It also includes a new cooperative game mode.
one new kid card to play up to 5 players

boardgame.name: Ecran pour Berlin XVIII première édition
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

The gamemaster screen for Berlin XVIII first edition is a 2-panel screen with player-facing art and gamemaster-facing tables.

boardgame.name: J.W. Talcum and the Blight Factory
boardgame.description:
"Do you suffer from a lack of excitement? Are you craving an adventure that will astound and amaze?

Conniving swindler J.W. Talcum is happy to waylay your woes and soothe your sorrow — all for a price of course. His marvelous 'miracle' elixir is sure to do the job!

We all need a little respite in these trying times — smoke chokes the skies and a demon secretly bleeds the land dry. Too bad Talcum is in league with the demon, leading victims to its doorstep at a nearby factory.

So step right up! The wonderous perils of Talcum's factory await you. Explore and investigate to unveil his plot. The people need heroes willing to put Talcum out of business!"

J.W. Talcum and the Blight Factory is a short adventure for four level 3 characters. It is setting neutral, designed to work as a one-shot or as a piece of a larger campaign.

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Player Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description: A deluxe player upgrade kit for Lords of Vegas. It replaces the tiddlywinks and chips from the base set and Up with individual cars and planes to give you a more immersive experience. Each player gets 10 cars of a unique design, ranging from 1930s roadsters to 1960s Italian sports cars. Each player also gets an individually named jet plane of their color, and a drawstring bag of their color as well. Also included are two casino dice to gamble with.

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Playmat
boardgame.description: A massive neoprene playmat for Lords of Vegas. This playmat reproduces the Strip from the base set board and Downtown Las Vegas from the expansion Underworld's board. For the first time there are spots to place casino tiles and risers on the game surface.

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Poker Chips
boardgame.description: A set of 100 stylish Lords of Vegas poker chips based on the casino groups in the game. Included are 20 of each casino's chip in denominations of $1 million, $2 million, $5 million, $10 million, and $25 million. Comes in a convenient chip rack.

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Unified Rulebook
boardgame.description: A rulebook that unifies the rules from the Lords of Vegas base set, Up, and Underworld. This convenient 12-page guide integrates the expansions' rules into the structure of the base set game, so you never have to flip from book to book again.

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Boss Briefcase
boardgame.description: A swank leatherette briefcase with felt lining to store your Lords of Vegas game and its expansions in mobster style. Contains a Lords of Vegas Felt-Lined Tray.

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Felt-Lined Tray
boardgame.description: A beautiful tray lined with felt. Can hold the tiles, cards, boards, rulebooks, and casino dice from Lords of Vegas and its expansions.

boardgame.name: Le Mont Saint-Mikkel
El Monte San Mikkel
Mount Saint-Mikkel
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

In a secluded corner of the countryside, on top of a hill stands Mount Saint-Mikkel. An ancient power awakened there and since then, the region has been subject to raids by the undead.
You have been assigned to solve the problem...

Baron Solreigh was surprisingly honest when he recruited you: if he offers a pouch of gold to whom will end the troubles that afflicts the mount Saint-Mikkel area, it is because it’s very dangerous.
He has not received news from any of the two groups of men — one of soldiers, the others composed of its five best knights—he successively sent there.
And if he’s going to lose more men, he’d rather they not be his own!
Reports mention an ever-growing troop of the undead swarming the villages around mount Saint-Mikkel—an old priory and pilgrimage destination long declining— leaving only death and ruin in its wake.
Listening to the call of adventure and your lust for gold, your group of Adventurers is on its way through the countryside. After a few quiet days, you can finally see the lonely and age-old silhouette of the priory sitting at the top of the hill through the morning mist…

boardgame.name: Bring It On
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A short adventure (2 - 4 hours) for level 2-4 characters. Whilst en route somewhere the PCs are onboard an airship. The airship is suddenly attacked and forced to crash-land in a dark forest. In order for the ship to be repaired the PCs are tasked with journeying to a nearby ruined temple to find some lead from the stained-glass windows. Easy enough... then a dryad army, an undead vampire, a lich, a suicidal ghost, and a maze made of fog get in the way...
boardgame.rpgpublisher: How to be a Great Game Master

boardgame.name: Stellarium of the Vinteralf (Elemental)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fire and Frostbite

The dragon-blasted stellarium inches toward destruction as the glacier grinds itself to its doom between two mountains. Treasure and eldritch lore will certainly be found within, but you are not the only ones who have come to claim its secrets.

Stellarium of the Vinteralf is one of the Ennie award-winning Trilemma Adventures by Michael Prescott. This version contains the original dungeon, expanded to include ELEMENTAL stats and a flavorful cast of player characters with their own agendas and motivations.

Drop Stellarium of the Vinteralf into your campaign or play it as a one-shot. Hand out the provided characters, place them at the entrance of the site and you can enjoy a session of gaming right away, with as little preparation as a board game.

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Game For Couples
boardgame.description:
Play with just your partner or with other couples in two different gameplays in this fun and engaging game! Spark meaningful conversations and learn new things about your partner or team up together to compete against other couples to see who really knows each other best.

TWO GAME CHOICES - Connect one-on-one your partner or play together with other couples in two different gameplays.
QUALITY TIME WITH YOUR PARTNER - Get to know each other better as you dive into meaningful conversations and perform funny challenges - perfect for date night.
COMPETE AGAINST OTHER COUPLES - Team up with your partner and play with other couples to see who really knows each other best.
BUILD DEEPER CONNECTIONS - The simple gameplay and easy rules allows you to quickly engage with each other.
REPLAY VALUE - 200 playing cards guarantees hours of replayability. Perfect gift for him and her - makes a great wedding, newlywed or anniversary gift.

boardgame.name: Bloody Basement
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloody Basement is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Bloody Basement
Bloody Basement depicts the kind of home and sadistic workshop of horrors that might belong to a deranged serial killer. From the mundane above ground domicile, to the easily accessible areas of the basement, everything here seems normal at a glance. However, fear and terror abound for those who venture into the basement's hidden areas, which include prison cells, a torture chamber, grisly trophy room, corpse-filled pit, disturbing alchemical laboratory, and an area where flesh golems can be assembled.

boardgame.name: Boggy Bayou
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Boggy Bayou is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Boggy Bayou
Boggy Bayou depicts a fetid bog where a ramshackle abode that's home to an acerbic swamp witch can be found. Rampant overgrowth runs thick and wild here, unchecked by any but the witch herself—who seems not to mind sharing her living space with all manner of plants, trees, bushels, flowers, and more. Whether the witch herself can be considered friend or foe, no doubt her surroundings—complete with alligators, giant mosquitoes, and awakened plants—should prove hostile enough to deter most visitors.

boardgame.name: Darkwood Lodge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darkwood Lodge is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Darkwood Lodge
Darkwood Lodge depicts a sinister cabin in the woods that's surrounded by strange animal warrens, cages for feral hounds, and pits for captives; overrun by a seeping blight that wells up from beneath the earth, and no doubt inhabited by murderous wildmen. Matters are no less grim within the dilapidated property, with fresh meat left to rot in the kitchen, a bedroom seemingly shared by an entire clan, and a literal skeleton in the closet.

boardgame.name: Follyfield Farmstead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Follyfield Farmstead is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Follyfield Farmstead
Follyfield Farmstead depicts the ashen ruins of a decaying farm house and some of the structures and fields that surround it. A sense of perpetual dread hangs thick in the air here as the shadows have grown long, the air chill, and the mood uneasy as a result of the grim scarecrows, sable crows, rusting machinery, and hidden graves that malinger around the site.

boardgame.name: Ghostly Galleon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghostly Galleon is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Ghostly Galleon
Ghostly Galleon depicts a spectral ship over four levels—overhead, top deck, lower deck, and the bowels of the ship—and the watery depths that surround it. Those who board the boat will find bodies in its bilge, eerie sights and sounds, and an awful surprise if they attempt to haul up its anchor, though they should be wary that the ship doesn't vanish into nothingness and plunge them into icy waters while they're on board.

boardgame.name: Gravechapel Boneyard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gravechapel Boneyard is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Gravechapel Boneyard
Gravechapel Boneyard depicts a lonely hillside graveyard and chapel during a torrential downpour. The chapel—along with the stone monoliths, gloomy headstones, and other grave markers that accompany it—threaten to be washed away by the heavy rain at any moment. The only obvious signs of life are the fire that burns in the hearth of the gravedigger's cabin and the eerie glow of blood-red candles that bathe the chapel's interior in grotesque light.

boardgame.name: Hospital of Horrors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hospital of Horrors is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Hospital of Horrors
Hospital of Horrors depicts a sinister facility that's somewhere between a hospital and an asylum. With multiple points of entry, several wards, consultation rooms, clerical areas, lavatories, a morgue, and padded isolation rooms, there's a lot to see and discover throughout this packed location. Though, visitors should tread lightly, lest any of the former medical staff or patients still linger about the place.

boardgame.name: Zealot Enclave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zealot Enclave is part of Bloody Blueprints & Macabre Maps, an eight-map series that's available as a collection Digitally and in Physical Print. Perfect for Halloween games or horror adventures, each map in the series showcases classically medieval and high-fantasy locations with a gloriously ghoulish twist, presenting each spooky and sinister locale in loving detail.

Zealot Enclave
Zealot Enclave depicts a cramped, claustrophobic, and constricting cave network that's been corrupted by the dark acolytes and cultists who've infested it. It features baptismal natural stone pools filled with blood, chambers where terrible rites are performed, places abyssal beings can be conjured and bound, areas to hold prisoners intended for torture and ritualistic sacrifice, and other equally unsettling chambers.

boardgame.name: Mined Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Published under the OGL and compatible with 5e and OSR fantasy role playing games, SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES is a 78-page book with adventures for characters of 5th-7th level, that can be played as One-Shots or as the second module in a four-part campaign. It's the sequel to Gravis Town Blues, but can be played separately from that title or as a continuation of the story.

Gravis Town is locked down as the Kal-Zar’s Bane virus runs rampant. A journal found in a lost shipyard provides the location of the long-hidden library of Kal-Zar Ro. The party must travel to the Orinspeak, a mountain trapped in perpetual winter in the heart of the forest.

There are questions to be answered, secrets to be uncovered. The truth about Kal-Zar’s Bane may be revealed. And the quest to find a cure can begin…

So, what’s in SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES?

· 7 adventures – puzzles, investigations, dungeon crawls, quests, social encounters - complete with full color maps! Varied adventures from 5th – 7th level, designed for minimal preparation and flexible delivery. Each adventure can be run as part of the ongoing Kal-Zar’s Bane campaign, or as a One-Shot. Every adventure has both Campaign-specific and One-Shot-specific hooks. The One-Shot hooks ignore all the sub-plots and provide you with exactly what you need to run each adventure as a one-off for your players - you can either slot them into your existing campaign or run them as separate, individual side quests.

· Loads of hand-drawn, full-color maps!

· 20 new monsters & NPCs and 9 new magic items!

· Fully detailed village and region setting– The Elven tree village of Ai’Pa’El is home to the An’st’rm elves and a potential regional base for the PCs in the vast Orinwood Forest. The elves harbor a secret that may start to unravel the truth about Kal-Zar’s Bane…

· Expanded map of Verona Province - including the Jarldoms of Skandara – a new, expanded map and brief gazetteer of the Invician Empire and Verona Province! More new and expanded lore for the Shotglass Adventures campaign setting!

· Full guide for OSR conversions!

boardgame.name: Background: The Survivor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a survivor. Your life has been altered by the terror and hardships of the world, and you are inexorably changed by the experience. Your sanity may be diminished, but you are hardy and ready to continue struggling for the next dawn. It is your wisdom and knowledge that will see you through another day, but that doesn’t necessarily endear you to others. You may have a soft spot for those who were once like you, less inured to the world and its challenges, so you may occasionally find compassion for them. You do not, however, suffer fools.

boardgame.name: Feats of Cold
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Feats of Cold you will find options for the pious and the devoted to include:

- Survivalist - You and your group can survive in extreme climates

- Arctic Survivor - You thrive in environments that others shy away from.

- Frozen Fortitude - You have developed the build and nature to maintain your composure in extremes.

boardgame.name: Chilling Spells
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Chilling Spells we dive into three twisted spells that bring the power of winter to the caster.

- Chilling Breath - this cantrip allows you to breathe cold on your enemies

- Wall of Cold - Add this chilling wall to your spell list!

- Icy Grave - This prison of ice is nothing to shiver off!

boardgame.name: Circle of Rime Druid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From freezing tundras to remote peaks, the unrelenting cold of nature poses both a threat and a challenge. This challenge, answered by towering trees, massive mammals, and hearty humanoids, is often survived, but not surmounted. A rime circle druid represents the unrelenting nature of a cold that chills down to the very soul. Much like the bitter cold itself, druids from this order both destroy and preserve and seek to challenge those around them to thrive in adverse conditions.

boardgame.name: Ghastly Feats
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These Ghastly Feats will chill you to the bone...:

- Friend of Death - Speak with undead and commune with them in other ways too!

- Grave Knowledge - You hear the whispers of the dead...

- Grave Sight - You can sense and locate undead!

boardgame.name: Apex Ram
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The apex ram is an amazingly powerful beast that has adapted to hostile environments and even more hostile predators. Although it is primarily herbivorous, it has been known to scavenge meat by scaring lesser predators away from their kills, especially when the apex ram is growing and maturing.

boardgame.name: Blade Stalker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blade stalkers are a menace to the lands of Khrota, they stalk the night with relative impunity. These terrible creatures are thought to have once been humans, cursed and mutated to feel pain at all times except when killing. The rumors persist and attempts to capture a blade stalker and reverse these changes have all met with failure. It is a foregone conclusion that a blade stalker is merely a remorseless death bringer, neither capable nor deserving of mercy.

boardgame.name: Gallows Golem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The gallows golem is spoken of in literature as a creature created to incite fear or despair in its victims. Often created as the enforcers for tyrant kings, or by the hand of insane crafters, the gallows golem is malicious in its actions, if not its intent.

boardgame.name: Executioner
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The executioner is said to be a singular being that exists to bring terror to the world, one victim at a time. It has reappeared in history books as a scary story to tell children, and a cautionary tale for adults. It has been known to fell king and peasant alike, and rumors swirl that its wrath can be directed with a ritual. If this is true, a cult could gain considerable power in controlling the creature. An apocryphal tale of the executioner destroying a cult single handedly might contradict this notion. On the other hand, all knowledge of the executioner is spotty at best. What is most certain is that most of those believed to have seen the executioner are dead or mad.

boardgame.name: Sour Tusk Lizard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sour tusk lizards are hearty beasts that have adapted to live in the harsh environs of Vathak. They can live just about anywhere, and are considered a pest by most peoples. Thankfully, they tend to avoid the cities, and aren’t typically interested in livestock. However, an active pack can sometimes deforest a region, and can eat several acres of organic material over the course of a year. On the bright side, they can be a deterrent to the more dangerous aberrations that stalk the wilderness, as they tend to clash with them regularly over territory.

boardgame.name: Needful Spider
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A needful spider is a dangerous and sinister creature that can infiltrate small and remote communities, and create a cult-like environment with the sole purpose of worshipping the spider itself. Needful spiders lack confidence, honor, and empathy. While they tread carefully at first, they become prideful and careless as they amass cultists.

boardgame.name: The Journal of Fighting Ships in Earth Subsector 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Incoming intelligence!

Ship captains need information about the systems to which they are traveling. These captains depend on Wendy’s Naval Weekly as their primary source of naval fleet information. It is rare to find a ship captain that doesn’t have Wendy’s Naval Weekly on their handcomps or mindcomps.

Wendy’s Guide to the Fleets of Earth Sector Volume 2 is the second entry of a series which will collate all the available information to provide a complete overview of the fleets of the nations of Earth Sector. Each of these books will briefly outline a nation’s spacegoing navy as well as provide some insight as to how that organization functions and provide a list of the ships reported to be in commission.

This book provides information on the space navies of Nigeria, the Pan-Islamic Caliphate, the Republic of Texas, Russia, the Southern Alliance, the Union of Scandinavia, the United Kingdom, and the United States. The book covers every ship currently operated in those fleets, their doctrines, and even their uniforms. The book also contains an in-depth discussion of the Shoal-class system defense boat, one of the many classes of ship used by United States Space Navy.

Get your briefing today!

boardgame.name: Fort of the Dragon-Egg Guard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sworn to protect the egg, the goblin group known as the Egg Watch will defend it with their lives!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a fortified cavern and dungeon, with a large dragon egg. Palisade fences, barricades and watchtowers protect the approach to the egg.

boardgame.name: Cave of the Great Pearl
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in a sea cave, unreachable to most, lies a great treasure
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a fortified sea cavern and dungeon, with a large pearl. Palisade fences, barricades and watchtowers protect the approach to the egg.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Dragon's Eye
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A powerful magical gem in the socket of a dragon skull, guarded in a fiery cavern

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a fortified lava cavern and dungeon, with a large ruby in the socket of a dragon skull. Palisade fences, barricades and watchtowers protect the approach to the gem.

boardgame.name: Shrine of the Winterflame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in a glacial cave, the Winterflame burns eternally.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a fortified ice cavern and dungeon, with a magic flame. Palisade fences, barricades and watchtowers protect the approach to the brazier.

boardgame.name: The Warrior Stones: Barbarian Hill Tomb
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Warrior Stones, a set of sacred standing stones, are well protected by those sworn to protect the burial site.
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a fortified barbarian sacred site. Snowy slopes lead to a set of standing stones, in front of a barbarian burial chamber.

boardgame.name: The Spring of Life
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wellspring of a magic river, bringing life to a frozen valley

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A 50x50 battlemap depicting a magical river, surrounded by greenery. It flows in a valley in the middle of a frozen mountain landscape, bringing life to a bleak wilderness.

boardgame.name: Terra Glacia Hab-Colony
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wellspring of a magic river, bringing life to a frozen valley

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A 50x50 battlemap depicting a magical river, surrounded by greenery. It flows in a valley in the middle of a frozen mountain landscape, bringing life to a bleak wilderness.

boardgame.name: Teamwork Power-ups
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The concepts presented in each Teamwork Power-ups are simple rules modifications and innovations for the 3rd edition of the world’s most popular OGL superhero RPG game. Each Teamwork Power-ups supplement is built around a theme and designed to spark the imagination of the Game Master and players alike. The mechanics herein are not necessarily new rules, but instead innovative uses of existing game mechanics to expand the potential and scope of play for the Team.

Teamwork Power-Ups focus on evoking those moments in comic books where two heroes might use their powers simultaneously to create a new and innovative third effect. Comics are full of these, taking forms such as toss ball specials (when a strong hero hurls a scrappy warrior at a foe), combined optical and shattering blasts, or laser beans projected off an ally’s shield. To take an example of two heroes, a combined power could be the Mystic archetype using their Spellcasting to charge the Crime Fighter’s boomerang, creating a glowing, swirling projectile.

boardgame.name: ガムトーク (Gumtalk)
boardgame.description:
ガムトーク (Gumtalk) is a game where you tell story about a theme you're given.

There's a deck of cards. There are 6 themes on the front side of the card. There's a number on the back side of the card. You draw 2 cards to choose the theme for the game. Once the theme is given you tell a story that is related to the theme.

The story doesn't need to be something entertaining or interesting. You can talk about anything as long as it is somewhat related to the theme you're given.

Other players who listened to the story says "That's a good story" once the story is ended.
publisher's summary
boardgame.boardgameartist: Soya Okamura (オカムラ ソーヤ)

boardgame.name: The Wind and Wilting Blossom
boardgame.description:
Navigate the war-torn lands of an alternate history Heian period Japan in this FTL-style roguelike, making tough choices in randomized events, fighting off a dangerous yokai army in tactical turn-based combat, and recruiting powerful allies to defeat the bloodthirsty sorceress Takiyasha, all rendered in the beautiful ukiyo-e art style.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Zjedz mnie
boardgame.description:
It has been known for a long time that in nature everything has its own order. The fox will eat a hen, and the hen will eat good grain or worm. Each animal just needs to eat its dinner. But a hungry wolf is a very bad wolf that can eat someone else's grandma. Sometimes you have to hunt for dinner, sometimes it is enough to put the muzzle to the ground, and sometimes you can eat up… waste.

What would the world look like backwards and what can a freak eat? Check it out by playing "Eat Me!"

"Eat me!" is a card game which, thanks to its funny convention, will familiarize the youngest players with the rules of consumption in force in nature. The players arrange the "food chains" from the cards in accordance with the rules of nature - predators eat herbivores, and those, as vegetarians, eat plant food. The game is enriched by action cards, which, for example, undo the player's movement, or the order of placing cards. The person who gets rid of all cards in their hand wins. The manual includes two additional gameplay variants: "Menu for the whole week" and "Everyone is very hungry".

boardgame.name: Kakerlacula Mitbringspiel
boardgame.description:
In the co-operative game Kakerlacula, players need to light all the candles in the rooms of the haunted castle — but Kakerlacula is dashing through the hallways trying to scare the children and force them to leave.

Players start the game with a number of garlic tokens, and on a turn, you launch one of the cockroach tokens on a catapult to see how it lands: Can you walk through the corridors, or will the cockroach scurry from one symbol to the next? If the cockroach crosses your path, you lose a garlic token. Can you complete your mission before you run out of garlic?

boardgame.name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Starbuck Promo
boardgame.description:
Kara Thrace "STARBUCK" promo from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter.

New Lieutenant with + 3 to hit modifier.

Talents:
- Daredevil
- Nimble Pilot
- Quick reactions
- Towing
- Marksman
- Troubleshooter
- Inspiring
- Religious

Flaws:
- Alien Spacecraft

Note: It is the same card as found in Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Starbuck: Captured Raider, but without the ship.

boardgame.name: Code On
boardgame.description:
A pathogen is causing a pandemic! Scientists are mystified as to which gene is causing global fatalities, provoking you to start a quest to uncover the pathogenic gene sequence. The genetic processes of mutation and indels hinder your discovery progress. Utilise your intellect, together with the powers of base sequencing and CRISPR base editing technologies, to correctly reveal the pathogen gene sequence. Crack the pathogenic code to enable scientists to develop a vaccine to save humanity from an impending health crisis.

During each turn, players have to guess a hidden part of the pathogen genetic sequence. With every guess, the player is granted information about how accurate their guess was. Using deduction and reasoning skills, player record this information and use it to get closer to cracking the true genetic sequence!

Each turn, players can opt to use one of their wildcards, which can either help (Helper cards) them or hinder (Hinder cards) their opponents discovery progress. Play these cards wisely though, as you are only limited to a couple per game!
A player wins when they crack the full hidden genetic sequence!

Can you crack the genetic code?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sagas: Bretland
boardgame.description:
Sagas: Bretland is a Viking themed 4X strategy game for three to six players where each player forges their saga as they raid Bretland in search of wealth, land, and fame.

Starting with a small raid party on the shores of Bretland, each player will explore the land, expand their colonies, gather resources, and raid Anglo-Saxon villages while battling any other Viking leaders that may stand in their way.

Players can win Sagas: Bretland by gaining 10 victory points. These can be earned by building new Viking villages, raiding existing Saxon villages, raiding other player’s villages, and completing specific objectives.

Who will be the next Great Viking Leader?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Dungeon Scrawlers – Heroes of Undermountain
boardgame.description:
In Dungeons & Dragons: Dungeon Scrawlers – Heroes of Undermountain, you and other adventurers are drawn together to delve into Undermountain, an immense underground of dungeons created by the Mad Mage, Halaster Blackcloak. Use your markers to trace your path, defeating monsters, casting spells, connecting artifact fragments, and collecting shiny treasure on the way! The round ends when one player defeats that dungeon's mighty boss, so you have only a few minutes to collect as much loot as possible. The player with the most points after exploring three dungeons wins!

At the beginning of each game, players pick one of five characters, each with a thematic ability that helps them collect one type of points more easily as they draw their line through the maze. Normally monsters or treasure need to be entirely covered with marker to be collected, but rogues need only to touch treasure, while barbarians need only to fill in the monsters' heads to defeat them! While anyone can cast a spell by tracing an intricate pattern, a wizard needs only to draw a small circle!

Dungeon Scrawlers contains ten unique mazes of increasing complexity, introducing new challenges as you go. These include portals, locked doors, multiple bosses, time limits, and more! With multiple paths through each maze, and over one hundred different three-maze combinations, you'll never have to stop scrawling!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ébredő erdő
Living Forest
Pradawny las
Strážcové lesa
Живий Ліс
리빙 포레스트
boardgame.description:
In Living Forest, you play as a nature spirit who will try to save the forest and its sacred tree from the flames of Onibi. But you are not alone in your mission as the animal guardians have come together to lend a hand around the Circle of Spirits where you progress. Each turn, they bring you valuable elements, so try to combine your team of animal guardians as best as possible to carry out your actions, but be careful, some of them are lonely and do not like to be mixed with others...

You have one of three ways to acheive your goal: by planting 12 different Protective Trees, by collecting 12 Sacred Flowers to awaken Sanki the great Guardian of the Forest, by extinguishing 12 Fires to permanently repel Onibi.

Each turn includes 3 phases:
• Guardian Animals (simultaneous push your luck phase) : You draw and turn face up, one after the other, the Guardian Animal cards from your personal stack. You thus form the Animal Guardian Help Line. You can stop drawing cards whenever you want. However, if you reveal a card showing a third solitary symbol, then you must stop drawing cards. This card closes your Help Line.
• Action phase: You play in turn. If your Help Line shows strictly less than three solitary symbols (not canceled by gregarious symbols), you can then perform 2 different Actions. If your Help Line shows three solitary symbols (not canceled by gregarious symbols), you can then perform only 1 Action. The strength of an Action is determined by the number of corresponding Elements visible on the Guardian Animal cards in your Help Line and on your Forest individual board.
• End of the turn:
- Onibi is attacking you: If some Fires remain at the center of the Circle of Spirits and that you cannot resist them, then add as many Fire Varan cards to your discard stack as there are Fire tiles at the center of the Circle of Spirits.
- Onibi is attacking the Sacred Tree: Add as many Fires to the center of the Circle of Spirits as there are Guardian Animal cards taken this turn.
- The arrival of new Guardian Animals: Complete the Guardian Animal reserve by revealing as many new cards per level as there were cards taken this turn.
- Giving the Sacred Tree: Give the Sacred Tree to the next Spirit of Nature clockwise.
- The Return of Guardian Animals: Move all the Animal Guardian cards from your Help Line to your personal discard stack.

The game stops at the end of a complete turn when one of the Spirit of Nature has managed to collect at choice and at least 12 different Protective Trees OR 12 Fires OR 12 Sacred Flowers.

Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 45 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
Living Forest Ein mystischer Wald, Quell der Ruhe und des Friedens, wird von den verheerenden Flammen des Onibi bedroht. In Living Forest schlüpfen die Spielenden in die Rollen der Naturgeister Frühling, Sommer, Herbst und Winter und wollen den Wald beschützen, indem sie die Flammen löschen, Bäume pflanzen oder den Wächter des Waldes erwecken. Wem wird es gelingen, Onibi in die Flucht zu schlagen? In jeder Runde decken die Spielenden – jede*r für sich – Karten ihrer Decks auf, die unterschiedliche Waldtiere zeigen. Diese hilfreichen Waldwesen bringen diverse Elemente mit. Doch unter den Tieren gibt es Einzelgänger, von denen nicht zu viele auf einmal aufgedeckt werden sollten. Mit den Elementen können die Spielenden ein bis zwei Aktionen durchführen und so Bäume pflanzen, Flammen löschen, sich auf dem Steinkreis bewegen, um diverse Boni zu aktivieren, neue Tiere anlocken oder Magiefragmente erhalten. Am Ende jeder Runde müssen sich dann alle Spielende gleichermaßen den verbleibenden Flammen im Steinkreis stellen. Können sie diese nicht abwehren, müssen sie Feuerwarane in ihr Deck aufnehmen – griesgrämige Einzelgänger-Tiere, die keine Elemente beisteuern. Nur mit Magiefragmenten kann man sie wieder loswerden! Das Spiel endet, sobald eine Person es schafft, eine der drei möglichen Siegbedingungen zu erfüllen.
Living Forest ist ein gehobenes Familienspiel mit Push-Your-Luck-Mechanismus und wunderschönen Illustrationen. Obwohl alle Spielenden auf ein gemeinsames Ziel hinarbeiten, kann am Ende nur eine Person gewinnen.
Inhalt: 4 Wald-Spielpläne 3 weitere Spielpläne 107 Tier-Karten 23 Feuer-Waran-Karten 58 Flammen-Plättchen 20 Magie-Fragmente 43 Baum-Plättchen 12 Bonus-Plättchen 4 Naturgeist-Figuren 1 Baum-Figur 2 Baum-Halter 1 Anleitung (DE)

boardgame.name: Get aCC_e55
boardgame.description:
Now the near future, cyberpunk, and you are a local geek. Not a scientist or a genius, but a very talented inventor. For the past few years, you have been living in a rented workshop next door to a bar. The bartender is your good friend and soul mate, however it was his idea with an auction and with a very dubious lot "time machine", yes. In general, now she is in the garage, and not a little effort has already been spent on her, but, most importantly, this is the new T9 string engine. It remains to collect it, well, and a couple of little things ... Well? To the cause!

Get Access - isometric puzzle quest with the mechanics of rotating rooms. You have to open what is closed, correct what is broken, find a way out of the rooms and solve various kinds of tasks and puzzles.

Source: The Publisher Website.
