boardgame.name: Abszolút megvadult betűk
boardgame.description:
In this roll and write game, by rolling all 6 dice you get the consonants and they can be supplemented with any number of vowels. You can write the word down in any connecting direction and shape when writing it on your board so that each letter is in the most suitable place. Who collects the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden Dungeon Master's Screen
boardgame.description:
From the product's slip sheet:

In Icewind Dale, adventure is a dish best served cold. Welcome to the Far North, an icy land of windswept land locked in a perpetual, dark winter. Journey past the Spine of the Worlds and enjoy the rugged hospitality of Ten-Towns, then brace yourself and set out to explore the unforgiving wilderness beyond.

The front of the screen features an array of sights from throughout Icewind Dale, setting the scene for your adventures in this bone-chilling world. A reindeer herd traverses the frozen tundra, Auril the Frostmaiden claims her latest victim, the fortress of Grimskalle stands tall in the icy terrain, and the ghosts of ancient frost giant jarls sit in judgement of those who would disturb their rest.

On the rear of the screen, you will find Icewind Dale wilderness encounters, wilderness survival, tall tales in Ten-Towns, a map of the Caves of Hunger for your players to explore, and more.

boardgame.name: Screams Amongst the Stars
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Screams Amongst the Stars is a minimalist, classically-inspired RPG about weird space horror in the frontier of known space, where organizations with conflicting interest are colonizing and exploring alien worlds. These worlds, however, are not exactly empty.

Characters in this game are spacers, people who work in colonies, space stations or on spaceships doing all sorts of jobs. They can be explorers, freighters, scientists, miners, technicians or any other occupation that would put them in space. And in space, they will find disturbing things.

These things can be flesh eating, chest busting aliens, for sure, but they can also be much weirder and terrifying things. Aliens that are always just in the horizon observing, but never truly revealing themselves. Astronomic phenomena that distort space and time. Ruins that change those that get inside forever. Can your rational mind resist these mind bending experiences?

On top of that, the game presents many different organizations, each with their own agenda and themes. And on top of all that, a complete toolkit to generate planets, ruins, weird phenomena, impending dooms and much more.

boardgame.name: 脱走名人 (Dasso Meijin)
boardgame.description:
脱走名人 (Dasso Meijin) is a game from Japan about escaping pet lizards. Each player is a different pet lizard which has got free from its tank in the game designer's home (the game title means 'escape master'). They run around the rooms and try to catch insects. The first lizard to get a set of insects is the winner.

The game designer (who breeds pet lizards) describes the game as a mix of roll & move and Old Maid, in that the lizards follow paths around, and steal cards off each other akin to Old Maid.

However, the game does not use dice. Instead, players choose a numbered card from their hand in secret, reveal it and advance as far as they wish up to the number. The lowest numbers go first.

Players follow paths around the different rooms in the home, and try to catch insects in the rooms or collect useful objects (by drawing cards). If a player gets into a room with another lizard, they can steal a card from the other player's hand. But some cards are also traps.

The pet owner is also moving about, and if a player ends up in the same room, they cannot move or they will be caught. So being able to predict the movements of the other players and the owner matters.

The first lizard to secure a hand of four cards of one type of insect is the winner.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Burekeke Games (ぶれけけゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Dogolrax
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Dogolrax is a 2D adventure inspired by Another World and Flashback. It makes itself unique by mixing different kinds of games and gameplay. So you'll find some kind of arkanoid or sidescrolling shooter and more, plus a bunch of anime style girls and weird aliens and some gore elements. The game is meant to be bizarre and grotesque.

boardgame.name: Dirty PJ
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MJ, prends garde ! La sédition menace, la mutinerie est à ta porte !! La révolution est en marche et ce sont tes joueurs qui en seront les fers de lance.

L'ebook n°5 de Places to go, people to be (vf), – la bible du rôliste engagé – met le feu aux poudres… Voici le couteau suisse ultime pour enfin montrer à tous qui est le maître à votre table de jeu. Car oui, il y a peut-être bien un seul meneur de jeu mais cela ne signifie absolument pas qu'il soit le maître…

From the introduction:

Dirty PJ: petit manuel du PJ tordu
Votre MJ va souffrir... et un plus il va aimer ça!

User summary:

A variety of articles about roleplaying, presented with a humorous tone, from the contributors to Places to Go, People to Be.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: The Grosbills
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Vous avez remarqué ?

Quand on se lance dans un projet de publication, il est assez rare de voir paraître un numéro 1. Mais il est encore plus rare de voir sortir un numéro 2 quelques mois après. Vous ne me croyez pas ? Jetez un œil aux fanzines, vous verrez.

Bref, tout ça pour dire que vous avez sous les yeux le deuxième ebook Places to go, people to be VF (au passage, merci de votre soutien et de vos commentaires, qui ont confirmé votre intérêt pour ce type de lectures) et que le simple fait de l’avoir réalisé est notre manière à nous de conjurer le mauvais sort. D’ailleurs, en parlant de malédiction, nous avons voulu en aborder une, très prégnante dans l’univers du JdR : le grosbill.

User summary:

A variety of articles about roleplaying, presented with a humorous tone, from the contributors to Places to Go, People to Be.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Transmettre la Flamme du Rôliste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous,

Et bienvenue dans ce troisième ebook Places to go, people to be (vf). La machine est désormais lancée et nous tâcherons de vous proposer un nouvel ebook chaque trimestre, deux mois après la mise à jour du site. Notez donc dans vos agendas que vos lectures numériques rôlistes connaîtront un pic les 1er mars, 1er juin, 1er septembre et 1er décembre.

Penchons-nous sur les sélections de ce trimestre. Après un premier ebook consacré au plaisir de la table et un deuxième à nos estimés grosbills, nous nous demandions quel sujet aborder. Non pas que nous manquions d'idées, mais plutôt que nous en avions trop.

Finalement, c'est la date de publication de cet ebook qui nous a aiguillés. Décembre n'est en effet pas si éloigné que cela des fêtes de fin d'année, des cadeaux, des enfants. Et puis les fêtes de fin d'année sont généralement un moment festif, chaleureux. Du coup, il n'en a pas fallu plus pour trouver notre thème du trimestre : la flamme du rôliste et sa transmission.

User summary:

A variety of articles about roleplaying, presented with a humorous tone, from the contributors to Places to Go, People to Be.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: La Théorie... c'est Pratique
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous,

Ça y est, la nouvelle année est bien entamée et je suis sûr que vos bonnes résolutions ne sont déjà plus qu'un souvenir (ne faites pas les malins, on est tous passés par là). Seulement, à Places to go, People to be (vf), on a décidé de tenir nos résolutions. Difficile ? Peut-être. Improbable ? Sans doute. Stimulant ? Assurément.

User summary:

A variety of articles about roleplaying, presented with a humorous tone, from the contributors to Places to Go, People to Be.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Le Plaisir de la Table
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A variety of articles about roleplaying, presented with a humorous tone, from the contributors of Places to Go, People to Be.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Une Brève Histoire du Jeu de Rôle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous et à toutes,

Vu que d’autres blogs se sont récemment fait l’écho de nos articles historiques, nous avons décidé de saisir la balle au bond pour vous proposer un dossier archéo-rôliste. Un très gros dossier (puisqu'il compte plus d'une dizaine d'articles) qui abordera tant les origines du jeu de rôle que sa création et son évolution.

Cet ebook (le sixième, déjà) aborde donc un historique rapide des jeux de simulation. Les JdR étant une branche de ces jeux-là, il nous semblait en effet judicieux de remettre notre loisir en perspective. Et pour cela, nous laisserons la plume de Greg Costikyan s’exprimer.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Le Père Noël est un Rôliste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous et à toutes,

Vous souvenez-vous de vos lectures d'antan, où il était question de la magie de Noël ? C'était une période de miracles et de fêtes, où un usurier avare pouvait voir le passé et le futur, et devenir généreux. Maintenant, cette période des fêtes est synonyme de courses au dernier moment, de déferlement marketing, de clôture et de bilan annuel, pour se finir (quand même) sur des cadeaux, des retrouvailles en famille et des gueuletons aux réveillons – à moins de s'entailler la main sur les huîtres ou de recevoir un bouchon de champagne dans l’œil...

Côté JdR, cette période est synonyme de pause dans les parties, de joueurs absents ou distraits... Évidemment, les merveilleux elfes-traducteurs de PTGPTB.fr (rejoignez-nous !) n'allaient pas laisser cela arriver ; au contraire, grâce à ce nouvel ebook, la magie de Noël va entrer dans la culture rôliste, et arriver sur vos tables de jeu, en rouge et vert !

User summary:

This item was published alongside two 2-page PDF documents of humorous, print-and-play "coupons" (one for players, one for game masters) that could be redeemed at the table.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Comment Écrire un Bon Scénario
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“OMG je me rends compte que je suis passé à côté de plein d’articles sur PTG, pourtant je pensais avoir tout lu ! (…) En fait j’y ai eu accès en tapant knudepunkt en recherche, mais sinon je les avais loupés, peut-être ne suis-je pas le seul à être passé à côté ? Ils sont super ces articles, et j’ai pas encore tout lu…”

- Voilà ce qu’écrit un des nos propres nouveaux traducteurs...

D'où l'intérêt des e-books : déterrer des articles qui sont perdus dans le site au milieu des 300+ autres, y compris depuis des années - et les ordonner pour qu'ils se répondent thématiquement.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Les Maîtres de l'Improvisation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Je n’ai jamais aimé improviser. M’y retrouver contraint, signifiait pour moi que le scénar était parti en vrille, et que ces abrutis de joueurs voulaient me contrarier ou faisaient n’importe quoi exprès. Je n’aimais pas non plus le grand vide à combler par mes : « euuuuh… ».

C’est pourquoi ma réponse, dans le premier article de l’e-book est : « rajouter plus de règles, plus de préparation ». Je parle même de « laisser aux joueurs une illusion de liberté ».

Et c'est là qu'arrive PTGPTBvf, qui a rassemblé les traductions qui proposent de rechercher et d'adhérer à l’improvisation. Les articles sélectionnés piochent dans le théâtre d’impro, et suggèrent même aux joueurs d’oser proposer des choses « bêtes », grâce à la phrase magique « Je préfère ne pas le dire… ».
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Bâtir une Campagne Mythique
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Harry Potter, Matrix, Le Seigneur des anneaux, Star Wars, Twilight (oui, même celui-ci)… Toutes ces épopées qui nous ont accrochés, scotchés à nos sièges et fait dépenser plein d’argent au cinéma.

Les Rougon Macquart, La Comédie humaine, La Recherche du temps perdu, Les Trois Mousquetaires (oui, même celui-ci)… Toutes ces sagas qu’on nous a imposé, que nous avons subies et dont nous nous souvenons malgré tout…

Toutes ces histoires et bien d’autres ont ceci de commun : qu’elles nous aient plu ou non, on s’en souvient. Elles ont toutes ce côté mythique du must have. Must have been seen ou must have been forgotten, c’est selon. Mais elles sont toutes, à leur niveau, des campagnes de jeu de rôle, avec leur succession d’intrigues, de rebondissements et de volte-face. Le genre de campagnes que les joueurs rêvent de vivre (bon, ok, sans doute moins pour les Rougon Macquart et La Comédie humaine), qui emmène leurs personnages plus loin qu’ils ne l’auraient rêvé et allume l’étincelle dans leurs yeux.

Toutes ces campagnes obéissent à des recettes. Toutes ces campagnes ont leurs trucs. Et tous ces trucs et ces recettes, vous êtes sur le point de les découvrir.

Car bâtir une campagne mythique est à la portée de tous les MJ. La preuve avec cet ebook.

Bonne lecture !
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: La Compil' 1 - 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:


Vous êtes en manque de jeu de rôle et il vous faut un palliatif ludique ?
20 minutes, c'est pas assez, et pas assez rôliste ?
Les 256 pages de Casus et les 114 pages de JdR Mag ne vous suffisent plus ?
Votre train est à l'arrêt depuis d'interminables minutes, et vous aurez fini de lire [quoi que ce soit] avant d'arriver ?
Vous avez aimé l'ebook n°X, mais oublié de télécharger le suivant ?


User summary:

This item collects, under a single cover, all of the convents of volumes 1 - 10 of the series.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Dawn
boardgame.description:
Players try to build a village together. As the game goes on each player secretly chooses whether they want to go for a coop victory or a single-player win.

Set in ancient northern Europe, Dawn blends strategy with unique player dynamics. As the town is being built there are threats that players need to decide if they want to fight. In the midst of this players have to also deduce who is helping and who isn't.

The game is played over the course of six rounds. Each round consists of three phases. First, players draw cards until they have nine in their hands, then they select one to put in their storehouse. During the second phase, each player plays their cards to either: perform and action (such as heal another player, or spy on a threat), try to build a building by playing a resource card face down in front of it, or try to thwart a threat by putting a card face down by those. Finally, there is the resolution phase where the cards played face down are shuffled and revealed to see if a building has been built or a threat has been thwarted.

At the end of the game, it is revealed who is a coop player and who was going for a single-player victory based on the amount of treasure each player has stored in their storehouse. There needs to be thirty prosperity-points worth of buildings built for each coop player or the coop players fail. If they fail, then the player with the most treasure stored in their personal storehouse wins the game.

Dawn is the next game in the Darkness four-part saga. Where Darkness represented players competing for limited resources, as they would during "dark times", Dawn represents what happens when people choose to work together. The next game, "Daylight" will be a pure coop game, and finally "Dusk" will be a legacy game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Le JdR, de l'Art ou du Cochon?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous et à toutes,

Après plusieurs tentatives d'esquive d'ebooks (compilation n°1 ptgptb, L'Ombre du passé ptgptb…), il a bien fallu se rendre à l'évidence : tôt ou tard nous devrions reprendre la route des dossiers thématiques trimestriels.

C'est désormais chose faite avec ce onzième ebook, consacré à l'art et au jeu de rôle. Y parlera-t-on de l'art dans le JdR ou du JdR comme forme d'art ? Aurons-nous des prétentions hautement culturelles sur notre loisir ou bien un regard blasé sur ce qui constitue surtout un amusement ? Porterons-nous aux nues les nouvelles formes de narration ou en aurons-nous au contraire une vision désabusée ?

Comme souvent, la réponse est multiple car le JdR recouvre de nombreux aspects. Nous n'avons d'ailleurs même pas de réponse absolue à ces questions, simplement de stimulantes pistes de recherche. Nous vous proposons donc d'embarquer avec nous sur les flots des courants artistiques et des réflexions culturelles. Avec, en premier lieu, l'interrogation la plus visible de toutes
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Narrativisme, Mon Amour
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous et à toutes,

On vous connaît, avec un titre comme celui de l'ebook de ce trimestre, vous vous demandez dans quoi vous mettez les pieds. Vous vous demandez même SI vous allez y mettre les pieds. Aussi, pour vous montrer à quel point cet ebook saura vous satisfaire, nous vous avons préparé un (roulement de tambour)…

Top 10 des raisons pour lesquelles Narrativisme, mon amour est indispensable...
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Fatal Fumble
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous et à toutes,

Numéro 13 oblige, nous avions deux possibilités pour cet ebook :


Vous refaire le coup de la Cène, dans les Évangiles, où 13 convives s'étaient réunis pour le dernier repas du Christ
S'orienter sur la malchance et ses multiples avatars, le chiffre 13 portant malheur selon la croyance populaire (alors que les rôlistes savent bien que c'est le 00, le 1 ou le 20!)


Seulement, comme on avait déjà parlé du plaisir de la table dans le premier ebook, on s'est dit que le remettre sur le devant de la Cène serait trop simple. Nous avons donc opté pour la seconde solution !

Ce numéro se penche donc sur la poisse en général, depuis l'imprévu jusqu'aux échecs, en passant par des comportements “dysfonctionnels” – et des solutions de secours. Un ebook tantôt irrévérencieux, tantôt sérieux, aussi mémorable que peuvent l'être les fumbles.

Bonne lecture.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Le Système, cet Important
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à tous et à toutes,

Avec les mouvements Occupy Wall Street et autres indignés, les dernières années ont vu l’irruption médiatique de nouveaux individus : les Antisystème.
Le développement des technologies, couplé à celui des multinationales, nous a plongés dans l’ère du cyberpunk. Une ère qui en appelle à un véritable Shock to the system.
Enfin, comme PTGPTB a besoin de l'aide d'un vrai connaisseur de Drupal (aidez-nous : ptgptbvf chez free.fr) nous en remettons au bon vieux système D.

Tout ça pour vous dire que nous nous intéressons ce trimestre à un des éléments fondamentaux du jeu de rôle : son système de jeu. Honni par les uns, encensé par les autre, il ne laisse aucun rôliste indifférent. Est-il importun ? Est-il impotent ? Coupons la poire en deux : Le système, cet important.

Bonne lecture.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Le JdR, c'est le Maaal!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Le climat actuel est à la grogne sociale, les inégalités se creusent ; le temps des bûchers et des autodafés n'est plus très loin !

Avec l'opportunisme totalement désintéressé qui la caractérise, l'équipe de Ptgptb a décidé de participer à sa manière à ce climat insurrectionnel qui se profile. Comment ? Tout simplement en se penchant sur ces temps pas si anciens où le JdR était accusé de tous les maux et servait d'explication toute simple à des problèmes qui l'étaient moins. Eh oui, en ce temps-là, notre loisir sentait le soufre et le JdR, c'était le maaal ! Bon, le JdR c'était aussi un peu le mâââle, mais ce sujet sera abordé une autre fois.

Quoi qu'il en soit, notre quinzième ebook vous proposera non seulement un rappel de ces tristes faits des années 88-95, mais surtout les mettra en perspective au regard des comportements actuels. Après tout, à quoi servirait de ressasser le passé si ce n'était pour mieux embrasser le sens de l'Histoire ?

Bonne lecture.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Mon Perso, ce Héros
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Vous le savez certainement, la rentrée des classes tombe cette année le 1er septembre. Vous vous souvenez aussi probablement que, chez nous, l'école est en théorie obligatoire jusqu'à 16 ans. Ce n'est donc absolument pas un hasard si notre 16e ebook sort un jour de rentrée des classes. Ou pas.

Tout ça pour quoi ? Eh bien, tout simplement pour nous intéresser au gros des troupes de jeu, au moins aussi nombreuses que les élèves face à leurs maîtres d'école : les joueurs et leurs personnages. Et, parce que ces personnages constituent le cœur des séances de jeu, ils en sont de facto les héros. Laissez donc le rideau se lever sur les meilleurs des héros : vos persos !

Bonne lecture.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Écrire son Jeu de Rôle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Pour célébrer la publication de notre 500e article, nous avons lancé le défi Trois Fois Forgé, un concours de création collaborative de jeu de rôle.

Comme nous sommes un peu taquins, nous vous proposons un ebook dédié à l’écriture de jeu de rôle APRÈS la clôture des contributions du défi. Non pas dans le but de vous montrer ce qu’il eût fallu faire mais parce que les conseils qui suivent peuvent s’appliquer à tout processus de création de JdR. Car même les créateurs que vous vénérez ont débuté un jour…

Alors, prenez de l’avance sur ceux qui apprennent en se trompant; profitez des conseils de conception et des astuces de structures de jeu, en vous plongeant sans plus attendre dans ce nouvel ebook.

Bonne lecture !
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Coup de Foudre à JdR Hill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Au moment où nous écrivons ceci, la Saint-Valentin n'est pas très loin et en plus, l'ebook que nous vous proposons est le numéro 18 ! Nous vous proposons donc un numéro sur un thème un peu plus adulte que d'habitude : les relations amoureuses entre personnages-joueurs.

Nous avons convoqué pour cela trois auteurs : Mark J. Young qui s'est penché très tôt sur la question, Lilian Cohen-Moore qui s'intéresse au comportement des joueurs et Connie Thomson, qui aborde la question sous l'angle le plus exhaustif. Pas de doute, avec ces gens-là, vous êtes à la fois en agréable et compétente compagnie.

Bonne lecture !

Benoit Huot
rédacteur en chef de la division “ebook”

P.S. : Pour les utilisateurs de Kindle, nous vous proposons désormais le format AZW, plus récent que le .mobi. Si vous préférez l'ancien type de fichier, n'hésitez pas à nous le dire.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Créer son JdR: L'avis des Pros
boardgame.description:
Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

L'été est à nos portes et avec lui la promesse de belles journées consacrées à notre loisir préféré. Mais l'été est aussi le moment où le cerveau phosphore à fond pour poursuivre la création du jeu de rôle que vous avez dans un coin de votre tête. Nous vous proposons donc la suite de notre triptyque dédié à la création rôliste, après avec l'ebook 17, Écrire son jeu de rôle : les attentes des éditeurs (surtout américains), le rôle de chacun dans la production d'un JdR, les retours des auteurs, les exigences des lecteurs, les supports dématérialisés... L'ebook 19 “Créer son JdR : l'avis des pros” aborde tous ces thèmes et bien plus encore.

Bonne lecture !
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Campaign Trail: Dirty Politics Module
boardgame.description: The Dirty Politics Module adds 24 trickery and take that cards to the game. It was included in the original Campaign Trail base game through stretch goals, and became a separate module with the release of the second edition.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Campaign Trail (Second Edition with Green Party Expansion)

boardgame.name: L'Accessoire, c'est l'Essentiel!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

L'été est à nos portes et avec lui la promesse de belles journées consacrées à notre loisir préféré. Mais l'été est aussi le moment... Hé, attendez, c'est le même texte que l'année dernière ! Le même que l'ebook précédent aussi ! Eh oui, un an s'est écoulé depuis le dernier ebook. Ne boudons cependant pas notre plaisir car, pour l'occasion, nous vous en avons préparé une compilation organisée, exprès pour vos travaux manuels estivaux : les accessoires de jeu et leur utilisation. Alors...

Bonne lecture !
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Le Marketing Rôliste pour les Nuls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Il arrive quand on ne l'attend plus, et pourtant, vous ne rêvez pas, il est bel et bien là. Après de longs mois d'attente, après plusieurs années d'un chantier initié mais jamais achevé, nous terminons aujourd'hui ce grand tour de la création rôliste. Nous avions commencé par les scénarios, puis les campagnes, et pensions naïvement ne faire qu'un ebook sur la création d'un JdR. Sauf que ce sujet est tellement vaste qu'il nous a fallu vous proposer pas moins de trois angles d'approche différents. Celui-ci est le dernier et aborde un sujet généralement mis de côté quand on se consacre à la Création avec un grand C : le marketing (qui n'est pas du tout un gros mot, d'ailleurs).

Cet ebook est également le dernier de votre serviteur qui, après plus de cinq années à vous préparer les sujets qui LUI faisaient plaisir (je peux maintenant vous l'avouer ^_^), a décidé de laisser de nouvelles forces vives prendre le relais. Vous pouvez donc être rassurés : de nouveaux ebooks PTGPTB continueront à naître, toujours réunis autour d'un thème commun ! Et ce ne sont pas les plus de 600 articles (à ce jour) disponibles qui me contrediront...

Bonnes lectures
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: La Résistance: Gestapo Event Cards
boardgame.description:
The Gestapo deck adds 9 new, unique events, which make the game more challenging for experienced players.

Use this deck instead of the event deck that ships with the game.

boardgame.name: Campaign Trail: Advanced Solo Mode
boardgame.description:
Advanced Solo Mode is a 50-card deck featuring new rules, new depth and solo mode debates. It can be used in both solo and multiplayer games (with humans). Each advanced solo deck acts as one AI opponent; multiple decks can be used in a game.

The Advanced Solo Mode deck offers an easy, medium, and hard mode. The standard solo play deck (contained in each base game) does not include debates and is approximately medium mode.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Campaign Trail (Second Edition with Green Party Expansion)

boardgame.name: Dungeon Drop: Limited Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
Flame Demon levels up! This limited mini-expansion includes a special class cards and an amazing metal Flame Demon cube that replaces the standard wooden cube included in Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep!

Additionally, this pack includes a metal Draglin Flagon and a special Flame Demon feat card to be used in Tavern Tales!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tavern Tales: Legends of Dungeon Drop

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

boardgame.name: Les PNJ Aussi ont une Vie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Les grandes lignes de l'univers du jeu ont été présentées et tout le monde à votre table a hâte de prendre part à l'aventure... mais cela peut ne pas suffire pour des rôlistes qui souhaitent une expérience de jeu réaliste et/ou immersive. Cet e-book réunit des articles vous permettant de donner vie aux « seconds rôles » de votre univers : de la prise en compte des dialectes parlés par les PNJ (et des jets de compréhension ratés ?) aux rencontres de passants atypiques ou mémorables, rendez vos Personnages Non-Joueurs plus vivants pour qu'ils ne ressemblent pas à un décor qui défile devant les yeux des joueurs et joueuses.

Bienvenue dans ce vingt-deuxième ebook, consacré aux petits détails qui peuvent faire toute la différence. Sur une idée d'un « monde plus vivant » de Benoît Huot, le précédent traducteur chargé des ebooks PTGPTB, je reprends ici la flamme en le remerciant d'avoir rendu plus accessibles (et lisibles hors ligne !) près de 170 articles en les sélectionnant et en les répartissant dans 21 ebooks, pendant des années.

Merci Benoît,

& Bonne lecture à vous
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: La Résistance: Mes Amis ! C'est La Guerre Deck
boardgame.description:
Mes Amis ! C'est la Guerre cards can be purchased in-game by spending a sum of dice that is 6 or greater.
These cards give players advantages and/or allow you to mess with your opponents, adding a fun "Take that!" element to the game.

The base game ships with its own C'est la Guerre cards.
The Mes Amis deck includes new cards such as American tanks, British commandos, and Allied planes.
A big help, and big fun.

Mes Amis C'est la Guerre is a 9-card deck.

boardgame.name: Joueurs, Joueuses et PJ, Mode d'Emploi
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

De nombreux articles ont pour thème « comment être un ou une meilleur.e MJ ». Mais les MJ ne sont pas seuls et seules à contribuer au succès de la partie ! Les joueurs.euses aussi doivent chercher à s'améliorer, à mieux se connaître, et à mieux communiquer leurs souhaits...

Cet ebook s'adresse donc autant aux joueurs et aux joueuses qu'aux Meneurs.euses : les articles sélectionnés dans ce 23e compendium vous inviteront à incarner avec implication votre personnage (côté joueur) et d'être à l'écoute des joueuses (côté MJ) en produisant des parties correspondant à leurs attentes. Quel type de rôliste êtes-vous et qu'attendez-vous de vos parties de JdR ? Jouez-vous pour jouer ou pour gagner ? Êtes-vous dans un groupe de JdR qui vous correspond ?

Répondez à ces questions (et bien d'autres) après avoir lu cet ebook !

Bonne lecture à vous
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Dungeon Drop: Wizards and Spells
boardgame.description:
Introduces 2 new game modes to Dungeon Drop, each of which allows the game to be played with 5 players for the first time! This expansion includes 9 heat printed 10mm cubes, 6 game cards, 5th player initiative token, hero meeple, scoring token and a rulebook.

New game modes:

- Sinister Spells: This competitive game mode allows all players to utilize the new spell cubes against one another. Drop a cube into the dungeon on another player's turn to petrify one of their abilities, syphon their life, or open an infernal gate allowing an EXTRA huge monster to emerge! There are 9 different spell effects, each represented by a unique heat-printed 10mm cube. Plays with 2 to 5 players!

- Wicked Wizard: This game mode introduces the concept of "1 vs. many" to Dungeon Drop. One player takes on the role of the Wicked Wizard, wielding their devious spells in hopes to keep the locations of their Sinister Spellbooks hidden and maintain their dark grip on the dungeon. Meanwhile, the group of heroes works together to find the hidden locations of the Sinister Spellbooks and gain the knowledge necessary to banish the Wicked Wizard from the realm! Makes use of the 9 new spell cubes and the coop goals from Dropped Too Deep. Plays with 3 to 5 players!

boardgame.name: Peindre un Univers Fictif Réaliste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Par définition, la fiction est une chimère, une illusion, une fable ; mais elle peut tout de même se faire simulation... sans tomber dans les limites de la reconstitution historique !

Cet ebook vous fournira des indications pour concevoir un univers logique, surmontant le grand obstacle nécessaire que l'on nomme simplification. Du besoin de chiffrer les territoires en termes économiques et géographiques, jusqu'au fait de requestionner le butin comme récompense, en passant par des exemples de jeux auxquels jouent vos PJ, vous saurez comment apporter du réalisme dans votre partie.

Le premier article vous avertit toutefois de la complexité de l'exercice. Alors, pour en finir avec les simplifications et les stéréotypes, piochez des idées dans les articles qui suivent pour concevoir un univers fictif réaliste !

Bonne lecture à vous
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Souvenirs, Souvenirs...
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pour célébrer les 20 ans de l'association, nous avons plongé dans nos premiers articles de grande qualité, en provenance directe du magazine électronique qui nous a donné notre nom : ptgptb.org, l'e-zine australien Places To Go, People To Be. Nous y avons sélectionné des articles de la rubrique « il était une fois » où lecteurs, lectrices, auteurs et autrices du site australien racontaient comment ils avaient découvert le JdR sur table.

Que notre site ait votre âge ou celui de vos enfants, nous vous souhaitons – comme toujours – une bonne lecture : voici donc une sélection de souvenirs parmi les plus vieux articles traduits par nos soins !

À nos souvenirs, aux vôtres, et aux souvenirs de ces auteurs et autrices que nous traduisons.

Bonne lecture à vous
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Bons Baisers de R'lyeh
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

N'est pas mort qui à jamais est lu...

20 août 1890, Howard Phillips Lovecraft apparaît sur Terre. Moins d'un demi-siècle plus tard, cet être quitte notre planète et laisse derrière lui un panthéon imaginaire qui hante toujours nombre d'auteurs et autrices.

Années 1980… alors que les JdR les plus populaires étaient orientés combat et glorification des personnages, L'Appel de Cthulhu (AdC) débarque et pousse les personnages vers leur déclin.

Ah ces yog-sothoteries...

Nous sommes nombreux.ses à avoir découvert le jeu de rôles grâce à l'AdC. C'est mon cas, en ayant lu certains textes écrits par ses correspondants mais avant même de lire des nouvelles de Lovecraft lui-même. Ce nouvel ebook « spécial 130e anniversaire » vous conduira des premiers JdR reprenant le Mythe jusqu'à des idées d'adaptations plus contemporaines, en alternant entre longs articles théoriques et articles plus courts et ludiques. On commence bien sûr par une présentation générale et un article sur le processus d'écriture d'un vieux scénario et on finira sur des idées d'adaptations contemporaines... car « Tu prends Cthulhu et tu adaptes » est un adage que vous connaissez bien !

Destination R'lyeh, sur les traces étranges du Maître de Providence. Maintenant, faites un jet de SAN.
boardgame.rpgseries: Places to Go, People to Be

boardgame.name: Endangered: TH2 + SiN
boardgame.description: Endangered: TH2 + SiN is a micro-expansion for Endangered that consists of two Ambassadors based on the Tantrum House hosts and a "Strength in Numbers" bonus.

boardgame.name: Endangered: Center for Biological Diversity
boardgame.description: Endangered: Center for Biological Diversity is a small expansion for Endangered that features new role powers for the Zoologist and the Environmental Lawyer.

boardgame.name: Over The Next Hill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of five settlements for the 5th edition of the world's oldest roleplaying game!

Over The Next Hill is a booklet containing five small towns that can be dropped into a campaign with minimal preparation. Each settlement is 4-5 pages long, and presents several NPCs, points of interest, and loose plot hooks that can be developed during play.

boardgame.name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Druuf
boardgame.description:
Klappentext:
Thema des ersten Ergänzungsbandes ist die Raumflotte der Druuf. Ein von Insekten abstammendes Intelligenzvolk, unterwarfen sie ihr eigenes Universum, bis sie durch ein Naturereignis in die Lage versetzt wurden, in die heimatliche Milchstraße einzudringen. An der Überlappungszone beider Universen kommt es zu den größten Raumschlachten seit dem Methankrieg. Eine Gefahr für die Galaxis: Zehntausende von Raumschiffen; ausgestattet mit modernster Technik - dem Lineartriebwerk - warten auf ihren Einsatz.
Auch dieser Band bietet wieder alles über Stärke und Zusammensetzung, Logistik und Organisation, Technik und Personal.

This expansion adds the faction "Druuf" to the game. This includes new units and background informations.

boardgame.name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Arkon's Robotflotte
boardgame.description:
Klappentext:
Groß war der Schock im Jahre 1984, als die Ganymed mit Thora und Crest an Bord nach Hause ins Arkonsystem vorstieß. Die degenerierten Arkonidenherrscher waren abgesetzt und der Robotregent von Arkon war an ihre Stelle getreten. Vor tausenden von Jahren gebaut und programmiert, setzt er nun alles daran, an die große Zeit der Alt-Arkoniden anzuknüpfen. Die Raumflotte - lange vernachlässigt - wird wieder auf den neusten Stand gebracht und die Rüstungsindustrie wird wieder zum wichtigsten Industriezweig.
Neben den üblichen Hintergrundinformationen werden in diesem Ergänzungsband mehrere Hilfsvölker der Arkoniden vorgestellt (Zaliter, Ekhoniden und Zekloner).

This expansion including new units and background information for Arkons Robotflotte.

boardgame.name: The Best of Christmas Game
boardgame.description:
Best of Christmas is the newest member of the LOGO board game family, featuring all your favourite picture, theme and pot luck cards.

Covering all the things we love about Christmas it even has the cutest Christmas tree that you decorate as you play the game.

It's a perfect bite-sized festive flash of fun to get you in the Christmas spirit.

HOW TO PLAY: You are testing your Christmas knowledge to climb up and decorate your side of the Christmas Tree. You’ll be asked questions which you’ll have to answer correctly in order to dress up the tree. The first team to decorate all the way to the top puts up the gold star and wins the game.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Best of Christmas Game: Not For Kids

boardgame.name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Terraner II
boardgame.description:
Klappentext:
Mehr als 50 Jahre lang hatte Terra Zeit seine Raumflotte aufzubauen, immer mit der Angst im Rücken, daß eines Tages der Robotregent Terra entdeckt und in sein Imperium einverleiben will. Noch ist die Zahl der terranischen Großraumer sehr gering, aber die Anzahl an Kleinstraumern (Jäger und Zerstörer) und das bekanntermaßen exzellente Personal der terranischen Raumflotte können das zum Teil ausgleichen.
Dieser Ergänzungsband zeigt den Aufbau der terranischen Flotte von einigen zusammengeklauten Schiffen hin zu einer modernen und schlagkräftigen Flotte; abgerundet wird das Bild von den Werften auf dem Mond und den Verteidigungsanlagen auf den anderern Planeten des Sonnensystems.

This expansion adds new units and background to the terran faction.

boardgame.name: Popcorn Poppin'
boardgame.description:
Don't be left holding the Popcorn when it Pops! Popcorn Poppin' is a fast and fun game where players must pass the popcorn bucket before the popcorn pops. While the time counts down, players follow the instructions from the die and pass the popcorn as quickly as they can before the popcorn pops!
-Manufacturer's description

In "Popcorn Poppin'", not to be confused with "Poppin' Popocorn", one player fills the plastic popcorn bucket with plastic popcorn pieces, start the time by pulling the cord on the back, and then press down the cardboard-and-plastic "die", which when released pops up and will roll onto a face showing what the player must do to pass the bucket of popcorn. Players keep doing this until the timer ends and the popcorn pieces are launched out from the bucket, making the player holding the bucket when this happens out for the round. It plays much like a game of Hot Potato with a jack-in-the-box from hell. The game continues until only one player is left. The last player left is the winner!

boardgame.name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: An der Überlappungsfront
boardgame.description:
Klapptentext:
Die Auseinandersetzung zwischen den Druuf un den arkonidischen Robotraumern bilden den Hintergrund des ersten Szenariobandes. Hier werden die Gefechte und Auseinandersetzungen, die 17 Monate lang an der Überlappungszone zwischen den beiden Universenandauerten, aufgearbeitet. Neben einer Reihe von Szenarien wird in diesem Band auch auf den Verlauf der Kämpfe und die Verluste auf beiden Seiten eingegangen.

This expansion adds new scenarios to the game.

boardgame.name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Maahks I
boardgame.description:
Klappentext:
Dieser Hintergrundband zur Perry Rhodan Serie stellt ausführlich die Raumflotte der Maahks zu Beginn des Methankrieges vor. Das Aufeinandertreffen zwischen den Arkoniden und den Methanatmern führte zu kriegerischen Auseinandersetzungen, die mehr als 300 Jahre dauern sollten. Auf Grund ihrer enormen Vermehrungsrate waren die Maahks in der Lage, ihre Verluste schnell auszugleichen - ganz im Gegensatz zu den Arkoniden, deren exzellente Besatzungen allmählich dezimiert wurden. Doch trotz ihrer zahlenmäßigen Überlegenheit mußten schließlich die Maahks das Schlachtfeld räumen. Ihre wenigen Überlebenden konnten sich durch den Sonnentransmitter retten und wurden von den Meister der Insel (Mdi) in der Zwergengalaxis Andro-Alpha angesiedelt.
In diesem Hintergrundband, der reichhaltig illustriert ist, werden folgenden Themen ausführlich behandelt:

Allgemeines. Wie kam es eigentlich zum Aufeinandertreffen zwischen Arkoniden und Methanatmern? Ausführungen über das Aussehen und Körperbau, Atmung und Körperchemie sowie ihrer Geschichte runden das Kapitel ab.

Aufgabenstellung. Nach dem ersten Gefecht mit den Arkoniden änderte sich auch die Aufgabenstellung in ihrer Flotte.

Stärke und Zusammensetzung. Jedes Jahr bekam der Imperator einen Tobsuchtsanfall, wenn die immensen Zahlen noch um einige Prozentpunkte nach oben kletterten.

Logistik. Werften Stützpunkte und andere Einrichtungen im Herrschaftsgebiet der Methanatmer werden vorgestellt. Nicht zu vergessen die Weltraumbahnhöfe zwischen den Galaxien.

Führung, Struktur und Organisation. Wie waren die Flotten aufgebaut, die sich mehrere Jarhunderte blutige Gefechte mit den Arkoniden liefern konnten.

Technik. Wie waren die Raumschiffe ausgerüstet, mit den die Maahks die Galaxies unsicher machten.

Personal. Selbst bei den Methanatmern gibt es einige Persönlichkeiten.

Datenblätter. Einzeln vorgestellt und mit Datenblättern versehen, werden die Raumer der Flotte aufgeführt.

Darüberhinaus bietet Ihnen dieser Band mehrere Szenarien für das Raumkampfsystem der Perry Rhodan-Simulation und für das Brettspiel "Der Methankrieg".

This expansion adds the race Maahks to the game. Including units, background information and a scenario.

boardgame.name: Mandragora
boardgame.description:
The school of magic is buzzing with excitement. It's almost time for the final test.
The apprentice witches go from shop to shop to find the magic items to demonstrate their skills in casting spectacular spells. Mandragores, a kind of Swiss Army knife of witchcraft, are particularly sought after.
Be careful with cursed scrolls, as the terrible curse they contain could very well cost you the victory!

How to play:
Each round, you can move between the different stalls and collect the ingredients and grimoires on sale.
Beware, each shop not visited will see new merchandise accumulating, sometimes face-down, which your rivals will be able to recover. As soon as you have collected enough items, you can use them to prepare your spells, offering points and spectacular effects!

— Description from a retailer.

boardgame.name: Cat's Tsukiji
貓的築地
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the most famous fish market in the cat's world, Tsukiji Market! You and your fellow kitten chefs are competing to get the freshest fish for your restaurant. The competition is so intense that you can't get what you want without stretching your paws all the way to the most delicious fish at a lightning speed. So spot on the fish, raise your paws, and grab them for the win!

Cat's Tsukiji is a speed game like no other because you will put on the cutest game component in the world — the cloth cat paws! You can choose the finger cloth of your favorite cat pattern, how cute is that! Each round, a number of fish cards will be displayed on the table. On the count of three, all players simultaneously point their "paws" at the fish card they want. If you are the sole player to point at a card, you get it for a set-collection scoring. However, if any other player(s) point at the same card as you do, none of you get the fish!

The first player to score 6 points wins!

boardgame.name: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Prophecy of Kings: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
The FS-TI4+ insert is compatible with the Prophecy of Kings expansion for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition.

It is intended to be used as an add-on to FS-TI4, the dedicated Folded Space insert for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition, in the base game box, occupying the remaining available volume.

The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Prophecy of Kings

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer: Twilight Imperium Prophecy Of Kings Insert Publisher: Folded Space Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Breukosaurus Rex
boardgame.description:
Breukosaurus Rex is an education game that helps children to practise fractions and calculate percentages and decimals.

In the game, players try to get on the other side of the island. Each turn, the active player will roll the two dice and will afterwards see how much they get. The player choses either to step forward, take cards or do both.

On the cards they can either see fractions, calculate percentages or decimals and then they must see if they match several cards to make 1 whole or 100%. If they can do that they win an egg. To win the game a player must get to the other side with 3 eggs.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Spirit Journey Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The king of a small island has found a way to ensure survival and prosperity of his beleaguered kingdom. Through supreme diplomatic efforts, he’s arranged for his daughter to marry the king of a much larger and stronger island that will protect his subject from their predatory neighbors. The preparations for a lavish wedding flotilla are underway and the whole island is rejoicing. However, there is a small problem: just one day shy of the wedding, the girl went to sleep and didn’t wake up. The king’s physicians found nothing wrong with her body and so the best shamans of the land were summoned to save her spirit.

User summary:

This game consists of a simple Attribute / Trait system coupled with a one-shot adventure.

boardgame.name: Schrödinger's Cat: A Game of Curiosity
boardgame.description:
Schrödinger's Cat in a pocket-sized game of curiosity that unfolds in ten minutes and stretches beyond the natural lifespan of the players. Equal parts infinite and intimate, two players, or two teams, take on the role of either the Cat Wrangler or the Scuba Master, making permanent, irreversible, life or death choices for their cat. Their goal, of course, is to keep their cat alive as long as possible.
Inspired by quantum physicist Dr. Edwin Schrödinger’s metaphysical thought experiment stating that a cat sealed in bunker with a container of radioactive poison - that may or may not have opened - is both alive and dead at the same time, this destructible game begs the question… does curiosity really kill the cat?

Perfect for curious players who revel in experiences that push the boundaries of what a game can be.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rioolratten
boardgame.description:
Rioolratten is an education game that helps children with reading comprehension.

In the game, players have to try to get out of the sewer. How do they do that? The player takes a card and has to give the right answer to the question. To respond to the question he has to look threw the flyers, catalogue... If the player gives the right answer he needs to look on the back of the card how many steps he may go forward.

If the player doesn't give the right answer than he stays on is place. To win the game the player has to get to number 55.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Minerały: Promo 1 – Pomost (Wollastonit)
boardgame.description: Additional tile with special "teleport" ablity.

boardgame.name: Blitzkrieg vs. Russia, 1941
boardgame.description:
Blitzkrieg vs. Russia, 1941 *attempts* for the Barbarossa campaign, to be what Frank Chadwick's classic little Battle for Moscow, 1st edition is for that battle: a basic, relatively fast and simple, very conventional hex-and-counter introductory wargame.

It is the same scale - 13 hexes from Warsaw to Moscow - as classic old SPI Barbarossa and might be used with that. Stalingrad *is* on the southeastern edge of the board, thanks to canting. And it fills to the maximum an A3/11x17 mapboard, although halves are provided for a larger, 17x21 one and larger pieces can be made from the single-set sheet.

Monthly turns, 37+2 German and Axis units, 30+5 Russian units. Russian units hidden until adjacent/engaged with a couple blanks/dummies.

Blitzkrieg mechanics for the Germans, pressed attacks, factory evacuation and massive replacements for the Russians, on one of my more beautiful maps.

(I finally figured out how to make the background other than stark, glaring white. Think fields of light green Russian grass with the darker green forest(, etc.).

This would have been good in the Four Roads to Moscow gameset.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: (TA)ALIENS
Taaliens
boardgame.description:
(TA)ALIENS, is an educational game that helps children with spelling, vocabulary and French.

In the game, players(the aliens) must get on a new planet because a comet is coming closer and endangering the planet. To be allowed to enter the new planet they need to collect 4 stars.

How to collect stars?
Players need to walk over the stars to reach the small planets.

On each star they need to practice a word. If this word is written correctly the player can stay and the turn is over.
When a player arrives on a planet he needs to write two words correctly. When the two words are correct the player receives a star.

In the pile of words are several cards stating the player can play another turn, the player has to move the comet forward or gets a chance to practice a word three times before writing it.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Minerały: Zestaw alternatywnych pionków
boardgame.description: Alternative set of pawns for Minerals game.

boardgame.name: Necropolis of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’ve spent months hunting the Bone Lord--a wicked magician with the ability to animate bone, skeleton, and other beasts. All through the holiday season, the Bone Lord attacked the poor village of Shadn Valley with an relentless onslaught of skeleton armies, animated pumpkins, and many other horrors. His plans only failed each time because you thwarted him. Finally, you followed him through the frosty mountains into the Black Wastes where he lives. Now, breathless, you stand before the gates of the land of the dead. You are about to enter THE NECROPOLIS.

Necropolis of the Damned is an adventure module for the Micro Chapbook Roleplaying game system set in the dark hellish region of the Black Wastes, beyond the mountains of Helick Water. It is the fifth and final volume in the Bone Lord Chronicles story arc. Thus, this adventure may be played on its own or as a part of the larger campaign series of books. It may also be played in conjunction with other Micro Chapbook products and genres. This book includes the basics of the rules for you to play the game. No other books are needed for you to enjoy this adventure! This final volume of this series features a singular Mega Dungeon as the adventure--the largest dungeon in any Micro Chapbook RPG book to date!

boardgame.name: Monster Mash Collection #2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the second installment of Monster Mash collection. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover a new creatures known as Occulord-kin, Elemental Warriors & Krylons. These creatures will add a new dimension to you Fantasy Hero campaigns.

These creatures range in size, power and abilities. The creatures will challenge adventurers in many ways. Adventurers need a challenge and these creatures will challenge them.

boardgame.name: Unusual Weapons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every fantasy hero campaign needs magical treasures for the adventures to find.

This series houses information on varies information on just such treasures.

Whips, Tridents & Glaives – These weapons will be discussed within these pages. These weapons once enchanted are wondrous to behold. Unfortunately, these weapons are not easy to master. Here is where you will find the information on such weapons. Here you will find the treasure adventurers dream of.

boardgame.name: A Nightmare in Porcelain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange things are happening in the remote woodland village of Highwolde. Weird, wild magics are corrupting both animals and plantlife in the forest. The villagers sought the aid of Meryndrax, a wizard who lives on top of a nearby hill, but those who enter his mansion are never seen again.

A nightmare in porcelain is a horror-themed adventure for three to five first-level characters that can be used as a precursor for the Unfamiliar campaign or as a stand-alone adventure on which you can base a homebrew campaign. It can easily be adapted to any existing campaign setting.

This module combines elements of classic, gothic horror with modern scare tactics, taking a fresh approach to the haunted mansion trope. Its focus lies more on role-playing and immersion than hack & slash and it's chock-full of handy tips for inexperienced and veteran DMs alike who want to set an appropriate atmosphere.

boardgame.name: The Swansong Tarot Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 78 card tarot deck is designed for use with the Swansong role-playing game.

Formatted to print beautifully in either colour or greyscale, the Swansong tarot is an ideal choice for anyone seeking an affordable downloadable, tarot deck.

The simple designs are rich in symbolism and history, intending to provide fuel for the imagination.

Tarot cards have existed in many forms for centuries. The tarot deck is somewhat similar to the one used in the the 15th century Italian game of tarocco, but the true origin of the tarot remains shrouded in mystery.

The ubiquitous deck of playing cards is derived from the tarot deck, swords becoming spades, cups becoming hearts, etc. The archetypal imagery and symbolism within the cards, particularly the major arcana, connects deeply to what Jungians call the collective unconscious, reflecting a myriad of religious beliefs and mythology.

The tarot cards have many uses, often for telling Fortunes or Stories.

Swansong is designed to be played with the tarot. Its stories are derived from the cards themselves.
boardgame.rpg: Swansong: Shadow of the Prince of Darkness

boardgame.name: The Blackwood Errantry Codex
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
The Blackwood Errantry Codex is the core book for The Blackwood, a fantasy setting for the award-winning Savage Worlds RPG by Pinnacle Entertainment Group. The Errantry Codex is loaded with content:

A complete guide to character creation, including 5 archetypal Blackwood cultures.
19 new Edges 10 new Hindrances, and 5 new Arcane Backgrounds
5 new Setting Rules to capture the feeling of folklore whimsy and wuxia action
26 Savage Tales, including a full Plot Point Campaign, The Way of the Elder King
70 new Encounters, including monsters, NPCs, and the dastardly elves
A two-page map in full color
A character sheet designed by Karl Keesler

You will also need a copy of the Savage Worlds core rules and the Fantasy Companion to play in The Blackwood.

boardgame.name: Vault of the Old Guard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vault of the Old Guard provides over 40 magic items of all rarities for your Fallen Camelot Campaign (though these items are easily usable in ANY setting). All items are tied to the Knights of the Round Table who owned them, include brief lore about the item and its owner, and and ranges from swords, boots, cloaks, rings, bows, and more.

Items include:

Mentor's Helm: allows an ally to reroll a missed attack role.
Bridging Spike: a magical pinion that makes scaling cliffs easy!
Fool's Scarf: grants immunity to advantage or disadvantage, at the risk of random teleportation.
The Last Stand: a sword that immediately heals you the first time you are reduced to 0 hit points.

boardgame.name: 1821 Η ΜΑΧΗ
boardgame.description:
Παιχνιδι ημι-συνεργατικο σε στυλ Ρισκ.

Οι παιχτες παιρνουν τον ρολο των Ελλήνων και ο μηχανισμος του παιχνιδιου τους Οθωμανους .
Σκοπος σας ειναι να ελευθερωσετε την Ελλαδα, με την βοηθεια και των αλλων παιχτων, απο τον Οθωμανικο ζυγο.
Θα πρεπει να καταλαμβανετε με επιθεσεις περιοχες στις οποιες υπαρχουν Οθωμανικα στρατευματα, να αμυνεστε τις Ελληνικες περιοχες κατά των Οθωμανων, αλλα να μην αφηνετε τους αλλους παιχτες να αποκτουν περισσοτερη ΦΗΜΗ.
Μολις καταφερετε να αφαιρεσετε και την τελευταια μινιατουρα Οθωμανου, ή μόλις ολοκληρώσετε όλες τις Αποστολές, απο το ταμπλο το παιχνιδι τελειωνει.
Νικητης ειναι ο παιχτης με την περισσοτερη ΦΗΜΗ. Κερδίζεις Φήμη κατακτώντας περιοχές και ολοκληρώνοντας Αποστολές.

Καθε γυρο χωριζεται σε δυο φασεις, Την Ελληνικη και την Οθωμανικη.
Η Ελληνική φαση εχει τρία βηματα

Ενίσχυση: Για καθε Οθωμανο που νικησατε στον προηγουμενο γυρο κερδιζετε εναν πεζικαριο.
Επίθεση: Διαλεξτε μια περιοχη διπλα στην δικη σας και επιτεθειτε σε μια με Οθωμανους, παρτε τοσα ζαρια οσο οι μινιατουρες με ανωτατο οριο τα 5 ζαρια .Οι αμυνομενοι παιρνουν τα ζαρια με μεγιστο τα τεσσερα.


Η μαχη γινεται οπως στο κλασικο ΡΙΣΚ συγκρινεις τις ζαριες και η μεγαλυτερη νικαει, στις ισοπαλιες νικαει ο αμυνομενος .

Μετακίνηση: Μπορειτε να μετακινησετε οσα στρατευματα επιθυμειτε μονο απο μια περιοση σας σε μια αλλη .


Οθωμανικη Φαση
Ακολουθει με παρόμοιο τρόπο τα βηματα οπως της Ελληνικης Φασης, μονο που πρώτα εχει την φαση "Γεγονος" (Γεγονός: Τραβηξτε και διαβαστε την πρωτη καρτα απο τη στοιβα γεγονοτων και ακολουθηστε τις οδηγειες) και τα Στρατεύματα πρώτα μετακινούνται και μετά επιτίθενται.
Ευχαριστο παιξιμο, εύκολοι κανονες.

Πολύ όμορφη και ποιοτικη οικονογραφιση και πολυ όμορφες μινιατουρες



Risk-style semi-cooperative game.

Players take on the role of the Greeks and the mechanism of the game the Ottomans.
Your goal is to liberate Greece, with the help of other players, from the Ottoman yoke.
Attack areas where there are Ottoman troops, defend the Greek areas from the Ottomans, but do not let the other players gain more FAME.
As soon as you manage to capture the last miniature of the Ottoman from the board, or complete all Mission cards, the game is over.
The winner is the player with the most FAME. You earn Fame by claiming territories and missions.

Each round is divided into two phases, the Greek and the Ottoman.

Greek phase has three steps:

Strengthening: For every Ottoman you defeated in the previous round you win an infantryman.
Attack: Choose an area next to yours and attack one with ottomans, take as many dice as the miniatures with a maximum of 5 dice. Defenders take the dice with a maximum of four.


The battle takes place as in the classic RISK you compare the dice and the bigger one wins, in the draws the defender wins.

Move: You can move as many troops as you want from one area to another.


Ottoman Phase: It follows the steps as of the Greek Phase except that firstly it has an "Event" phase (Event: Pull and read the first card from the event deck and follow the instructions) and their armies move first and then attack.

Pleasant play, easy rules.

Very beautiful and quality iconography and very beautiful miniatures.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Rush: Elemental Uprising
Kingdom Rush: Sturm der Elemente
boardgame.description:
Kingdom Rush: Elemental Uprising is a fully co-operative standalone board game for 1 to 4 players that offers the ultimate tower-defense experience for the tabletop.

Players take on the roles of asymmetrical heroes defending their kingdom against waves of incoming monster hordes. Players play towers to attack hordes, using polyomino tiles to cover monsters until all monsters in a horde are covered, destroying it. Players will earn crystals and gold which can be spent on buying new towers or Tower Modifications to improve and customize their existing towers.

Monsters come with a range of special abilities that players will have to plan around, passing towers between each other, and positioning attacks to get around magic shields and monster powers. The heroes will also be confronted with game-changing events and elemental disruptions such as volcanoes and cyclones.

The game is scenario-based and can be played as individual replayable scenarios or as a steadily evolving campaign leading up to big boss fights, hero challenges, and more.

Kingdom Rush offers simple to learn rules with a high level of tactics for experienced gamers. Upon starting each scenario, players will be able to choose from a range of difficulty levels or even take on the dreaded Iron Challenges which require near-perfect strategies to overcome.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mierzoet
boardgame.description:
Mierzoet, is an educational game that helps children of all ages to learn more about healthy food, the food triangle and the nutrient code.

In the game, the player(the ants)needs to go to one of the piles, to collect 5 cards at the end of the game. Each turn, the active player will roll the die, and move his ant forward. When one of the players gets to the pile, he may pick a card. The goal is to select a card with as less sugars as possible. The player can take the card home and the ant flies back to the start circle in his own color.

Once each player collected 5 cards, they may turn the cards to compare which player has the healthiest cards. The player with the healthiest cards wins this round and gets a piece of fruit. The players can play as many rounds as they want. The ant colony which has the most pieces of fruit in the end wins the game.

Afterwards they can also see how healthy their food is with the food triangle or the nutrient code.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Uly & Polly
Wilson & Shep
boardgame.description:
Wilson & Shep, a.k.a. Uly & Polly, is a semi-cooperative game in which each round one player competes against all others. This one player is Wilson, the mischievous little wolf who likes to hide in the flock of sheep. Everyone else works together as Shep the sheepdog to find the little wolf's hiding place.

To set up for the round, lay out the sixteen sheep tiles. While all other players close their eyes, Wilson then swaps the wolf token for one of the sheep. The Shep players then place the sheepdog token on a tile and reveal it. If they already found Wilson, they win the round, but if not the Wilson player chooses two tiles adjacent either orthogonally or diagonally (whether Wilson is on one of those tiles or not) and swaps them. Shep then moves to any adjacent tile and reveals it.

If Wilson is still in hiding after eight tiles have been revealed, the Wilson player wins the round and receives reward tokens; otherwise the Shep players receive rewards. After each player has been Wilson once, whoever has the most rewards wins!

boardgame.description:
Emily has a problem. One day, a long, meaty cock appeared in between her legs. Ashamed of her new member, she became a shut-in and avoided opening up to other people. The fact that she has to beat her meat multiple times a day to stay sane doesn’t help either. She now works at a restaurant and bar, where no one else knows about her little (huge) problem.

It’s been several years now, and Emily has realized that unless she makes a change in her life soon, all she will have to look forward to is constant masturbation and loneliness. Help her overcome her fears and get her to open up to her co-workers. Perhaps in time they will open up (their legs) to her as well.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.description:
Our 35th issue features Austro-Hungarian battleships, the proud fleet flagship Viribus Unitis and her sisters, the projected Ersatz Monarch class-dreadnoughts that would have followed them, and the Radetzky-class semi-dreadnoughts that came before them.

Golden Journal No. 35: Viribus Unitis has 20 new die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, with all of those variant dreadnoughts and semi-dreadnoughts for your gaming pleasure, plus additional scenarios for Jutland and Wine-Dark Sea so you can play with them.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Caper: Europe
boardgame.description:
Your role as criminal mastermind is to recruit a crew of thieves, send them to locations across Europe, and provide them with gear. It's your job to utilize your resources efficiently to steal goods, but being a great mastermind is about more than the things you walk away with. It's the thrill of a well thought-out plan coming together: the set-up, the sting. Properly deploy your thieves and gear to dominate locations, outmaneuver your opponent's plans, and win the night. You've got six rounds to plan and play your cards. Nothing like a tight timeline to up the stakes!

Caper: Europe is a two-player drafting game. You take turns sending thieves to famous locations across Europe, vying for control through special card powers. These thieves have tricks up their sleeves, which you can enhance by adding gear to them. And controlling the locations isn't everything because priceless stolen goods await the thief who's clever enough to snatch them first.

Your goal is to score the most points by winning locations, collecting stolen goods, and equipping thieves with their preferred gear. The mastermind with the most points, tallied at the end of six rounds, wins.

boardgame.name: Kaplice Sigmara
Santuarios de Sigmar
Shrines of Sigmar
Святилища Сигмара
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five Shrines of Sigmar

The Old World is steeped in staunch spiritual beliefs, some of which have sparked battles and incited wars. Though they may differ in importance and prominence, all ensure reverence and honour. Shrines of Sigmar offers a selection of unique and mysterious shrines from around the Empire. They are perfect for dropping into an ongoing Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay campaign, or can be used to kick start an exciting new adventure. Each one is packed with colour and detail, laced with intrigue, and comes with a table of unique blessings for those rare few worthy of Sigmar’s favour.

While a multitude of Gods, old and new, are worshiped across the Empire, none can claim a greater prominence than Sigmar. As a man, Sigmar founded the Empire, and as a God he cemented his presence at every level of society. His is not a subtle faith — his priests preach his word from fine temples and modest shrines, hammer held in a familiar grip, both a symbol of their faith and a practical weapon to be wielded against the Empire’s enemies. While most of these shrines are just what they seem — a decorative and impressive way to honour Sigmar — a select few hold incredible and extraordinary secrets.

Five Shrines of Sigmar includes:

Steinplatz Shrine: The Steinplatz shrine houses a reliquary containing the severed hand of Grand Theogonist Helmgart — so suffused with the spiritual faith of its owner that even now the fingernails continue to grow.
The Shrine of Uathach: A follower of Sigmar while both still lived, Uathach was raised above all others by Sigmar himself after he gave his life in defence of the nascent Empire — or so the priests of the Lower Bӧgen Valley believe.
The Hammer’s Stand: Deep in the forests of the Empire, a solitary devoted follower of Sigmar spends her days high atop a wooden pillar, her humble life of suffering devoted to the worship of Sigmar.
The Abandoned Shrine of Lowengen: Deep in the Westlaufholz woods are the ruins of Lowengen, a village long abandoned to the forest. Centuries ago the villagers took up arms and marched to join the Vampire Wars — none returned.
The Sumpftor Shrine: A fine, if somewhat uninspired Shrine to Sigmar favoured by those travelling north from Fielbach toward Altdorf, the true devotees of Sumpftor Shrine see in Sigmar a truth that few would dare even to speak aloud…

boardgame.name: #iHunt: Player's Companion & Quickstart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a hero. You pick the hours.

This is not the core rulebook for #iHunt, but instead the bare minimum tools to play. It’s a reference guide so you can make your hunters, pit them against monsters, and tell cool stories.

If you have the #iHunt core rulebook, then this book is an invaluable quick reference of particular value at the table when players need to make characters or find a rule quickly.

Additionally, this book features a crew of hunters fully built and fleshed out with motivations, a hangout, and enemies.And it has a toolkit adventure ready to play! This way you can just jump right into your first game.

boardgame.name: Mint Bid
boardgame.description:
Mint Bid is a refreshingly light auction game for 1 to 6 players with easy-to-learn rules, lightning-fast setup, and exciting social gameplay, all in 30 minutes!

The game's compact size makes it easy to put in your pocket and take anywhere. Couple that with its simple rules and setup, and Mint Bid is like carrying a party in your pocket!

The most unique part of Mint Bid is that every winning bid is shared between two adjacent players, so each player has to compete and cooperate to gain a competitive advantage.

Victory in Mint Bid is simple to understand: whoever has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins!

Getting the most Victory Points isn't always so simple, though. Since all Victory Points are shared between pairs of players, players must strategically win auctions, place Locations, and utilize the Location's special actions to ensure victory.

-description from publisher

Камни Рагнарёка
boardgame.description:
Ragnarocks is a 2-player area control game designed by Gord! - the designer of Santorini and Santorini: New York. In Norse mythology, humans exist in the land of Midgard - a place in the center of the world tree and connected to the nine realms. Among these nine realms live gods and goddesses, serpents and spirits, and all manner of mythical and mystical creatures.

In Ragnarocks you take on the role of a Viking clan using Runestones to mark your clan’s claims of land. In the advanced game, your clan worships one of these powerful beings from another realm who lends you their power to help you outwit rivals and claim territories for your clan.
At the end of the game, the clan who controls the most territory in Midgard wins!

A player's turn consists of a move phase and a summoning phase.
During the move phase you move one of your active Vikings any number of spaces in a straight line.
During the summoning phase you summon a runestone and place it on any space along a path following a straight line from the location of the Viking you moved. Whenever a summoning creates an encloses area containing only vikings of a single clan, that area becomes settles and belongs to the player whose clan occupies it.

When all vikings have settled, the player who controls the most territory wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game is a map drawing game that puts you in control of a dwarven hold as you discover the horrors that lurk below. This zine has everything you need to generate natural formations, forgotten ruins, enemies, wyrd magics, and ancient monstrosities. It has a simple turn-based combat system, rules for building your hold and optional challenges for a harder experience.

Inspired by games like Dwarf Fortress and Dungeon Keeper, DELVE aims to capture that feeling of building and protecting a fortress in an unforgiving subterranean world.

All you need to play is, a pencil, paper (preferably 1" grid), and a deck of playing cards.
boardgame.rpg: DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game

boardgame.name: RISE: A Game of Spreading Evil
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

RISE: A Game of Spreading Evil is the evil sister of DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game.

RISE: A Game of Spreading Evil is a map drawing game that puts you in control of a monstrous dungeon as you seek to reach the surface and take over their puny kingdoms. As long as you can keep your mutinous minions under control that is.

This 41 page zine has everything you need to generate natural formations, forgotten ruins, enemies, magics, artefacts, and heroes. It has a simple turn-based combat system, rules for building your dungeon and optional challenges for a harder experience.

Inspired by games like Dwarf Fortress and Dungeon Keeper, RISE aims to capture that feeling of building and ruling a dungeon, dealing with mutinous minions, and proving that you are the One True Evil.

All you need to play is, a pencil, paper (preferably 1" grid), and a deck of playing cards.
boardgame.rpg: RISE: A Solo Game of Spreading Evil

boardgame.name: UMBRA: A Solo Game of Final Frontiers
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

UMBRA: A Solo Game of Final Frontiers is a map drawing game that puts you in control of a sci-fi colony as you struggle against starvation, the void, and the many threats that will assail you from above and below. This 48 page zine has everything you need to generate natural formations, alien ruins, enemies, technologies, and forgotten terrors. It has a simple turn-based combat system, rules for building your colony and optional challenges for a harder experience.

Inspired by games like Rimworld and Dwarf Fortress, UMBRA aims to capture the feeling of building and protecting a colony on an unforgiving alien planet.

All you to play is, a pencil, paper (preferably 1" grid), and a deck of playing cards.
boardgame.rpg: UMBRA: A Solo Game of Final Frontiers

boardgame.name: Excavation Earth: Pretty Boxes & Ancient Artefacts
boardgame.description:
Excavation Earth: Pretty Boxes & Ancient Artefacts contains two sets of alternate artifact tiles — "Ancient things" and "Things that make noise" — as well as a "Pretty Box" expansion that adds one new artefact of each color, with that artefact being placed on top of the matching black market stack when revealed instead of on the map.

This item was a Kickstarter Limited Exclusive included in the Explorer, Envoy, and Collector pledges, and it's labeled "PROMO 01".

boardgame.name: Caverns of the Frost Giant
boardgame.description: Frost giants live for the fight. Hardheaded and stubborn, their bloodlust is matched only by their brute strength. Though they rush into battle, their survival instinct is strong, so watch your step when entering a frost giant lair. These tyrants have a nasty habit of laying murderous traps...

boardgame.name: Hall of the Orc King
boardgame.description: In winter, death comes down from the mountain where the orc king dwells. His followers launch brutal raids on nearby settlements before vanishing into the snow. All the while, rumours swirl that in his icy hall, the king grows stronger, his ambitions grander, and his army greater. It will take a group willing to brave the wilderness to thwart him.

boardgame.name: Animal Adventures RPG Starter Set
boardgame.description: Created for beginners, this set is your gateway into the magical world of roleplaying games. Inside is everything you need to play a thrilling RPG campaign, with no experience needed. Explore exciting locations, face fearsome and fantastical beasts, and have fun!

boardgame.name: HeroQuest: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
HEROQUEST THE CARD GAME: Players try to make it out of the dungeon together in this card game based on the fantasy adventure board game

DEFEAT ZARGON: The goal is to defeat Zargon by depleting the dungeon deck to expose the dungeon exit before any one hero sustains 4 wounds, including permanent wounds and wound cards

CHOOSE A HERO: Each player chooses a hero to play as, and takes the corresponding hero champion tile. The tiles are double-sided showing male and female variants and players can decide on which side they prefer (your gender doesn't impact gameplay)

ACTION PHASE: After playing a card, the action phase begins. Choose one of 3 possible actions: Attack a threat on the dungeon floor, attempt to heal a wound, or search for treasure

DUNGEON CRAWL EXPERIENCE: Don't have a lot of time? The HeroQuest card game is quick to play, and makes a compact dungeon crawl experience.
